description:
May, the bartender, was excellent.  She was funny, engaging, and attentive.  We wanted to order the calamari and, because we had already stopped at a few other places, we almost backed out.  With her recommendation, tho, we decided to order them.  They were really good.   

I recommend coming to the Last Drop Tavern for drinks and food.
author: Howard C.

description:
I wasn't going to tell my story but after talking to my friends who are bartenders and servers, I feel like I should. 

Long story short, I went out with co workers and one brought her sister. After we split the bill, I realized the sister didn't pay because she was going to "pay her sister later". Which was fine but that meant that I paid for her portion. I knew it wasn't right, but I also didn't want to pay for her portion and tip the server, otherwise I would feel taken for a fool. So I didn't tip. I planned on making it up to the server at another time since the bar is by my office. 

HOWEVER, the server had the audacity to come up to me, tap me on the shoulder and say "sir if you can't afford to come out, don't come out at all!" Excuse me? He also told my co worker that I was "marked" the next time I came in, whatever that meant. The server didn't know what was going on, but he had the balls to disrespect like that. 

A few days later, I noticed on my credit card statement that the server gave himself a $10 tip. I called my credit card who refunded my $$. I was surprised but not that surprised that a ghetto server would tip himself without my consent. 

My friends who are servers and bartenders said it sucks when they don't get tips, but they don't know the other side so they just keep working and it's not a big deal. After all there will be more tips. 

Anyway, keep in mind if you don't tip to however the servers like, they'll tip themselves and publicly shame you. Which is absolutely ridiculous because my value to them would have been much more over time and it wasn't worth fighting over. But it's downtown San Francisco and there's plenty of other bars to choose from. 

I'd say skip this place.
author: Lucas M.

description:
This is a historic location, with a "hanging" theme, based upon its location in the town of Edinburgh.  Clean and comfortable inside. 

The decor includes paintings of hangings, rope nooses, and historical documents on the wall featuring the rogues in the past that had suffered the "last drop" of the hangings that took place just outside the door.

I sat at the bar and based upon previous Yelpers who have eaten here, I had the burger and haggis, and a beer.  The bartender was fantastic.  Really great service, fast, and professional. 

The burger, however, was kind of bland.  Bread, a burger patty, cheese, but not flavorful.  The haggis was much better and was a welcome addition to the plate.  

I'm certain that there are other menu items that are better to try, but I can't recommend the burger.  I can recommend the haggis, however, and as mentioned, the service was fantastic.
author: Robert M.

description:
Got into town a bit late. It was a short walk. I ordered wine and the glass was already poured and sitting in the cooler. Not sure how long. I sent it back and ordered a draft.

Food was nothing to write home about.  Very basic but not bad. 

I had the salad with Gorgonzola, pears and walnuts. It was good. Light dressing. 

Basic bar food.
author: Christina S.

description: Mae's mai tai are 100 times better tha.n Tonga"s. Go here instead of Tonga. Good food and great service!
author: Jacob K.

description:
Warning: eat here at your own risk.

I had the beef fajitas, which came with baked beans and guac, and a side of steamed veggies for dinner.

That same night I had a very bad stomachache and bad digestion problems. I didn't eat lunch that day, and never had food poisoning in years until I ate here.

Be careful.
author: John L.

description:
Happy Hour runs until 7pm and offers $5 well drinks.  I had a couple of Manhattans and was kind of surprised at how tasty they were without me having to call a top shelf brand like Makers Mark etc..

Service was very good.  We were a party of six and moved a couple of times until we found a spot where all of us could be together.  It's a bit cramped but we scored the little nook as soon as you walk in and it was quite cozy.   We watched the cable cars go by outside our window and we were also able to watch a bit of March Madness.

The food looked great.  I saw quite a few platters of sliders go by as well as chicken wings.  

Pretty neat little spot--good find.
author: Thomas D.

description:
We grabbed beers and lunch here for the first time last week. The Tavern was friendly, the beers cold and the food actually quiet good. I had the salad and sliders; no complaints. I can see this as a friendly neighborhood hangout or someplace low key to visit when just passing through The City. 

It has the feel of a English Pub, but obviously a Tavern. ;-)
author: John W.

description:
Clusterfest weekend in SF and I wanted to grab a bite to eat and some drinks locally rather than indulge in the outrageous pricing that is festival concession.

Dark, pub-like space. High top tables, communal tables in the back, and bar seating. Relatively empty on a Friday for Happy Hour. 5 dollar well drinks???? o m g. Ordered a few rounds of tequila and had their burger, which was pretty standard but delicious nonetheless. I left feeling full, tipsy, and ready to laugh my a** off at Clusterfest. Thank you Last Drop Tavern!
author: Genevieve M.

description: From the bar bites to the cocktails to the beer, this place is a winner. Try one of the  egg white sours such as Honey Bourbon - yum. Nice atmosphere and good service. What more do you need?
author: Susan B.

description:
Small space but great atmosphere.  Had the Mac cheese appetizer with bacon and it was amazing.  
Blood orange margaritas are delicious but they dont have tajin so beware.  Chicken sandwich was really good.  Dodger fans everywhere so it was a great night.
author: Jeff V.

description:
Come here during happy hour.

$5 old-fashioned? $5 manhattan? $5 draft beers? $5 fries? $5 buffalo wings?

Expect to see me here a lot.
author: Sang P.

description: Outstanding place. Great food, great location, great service, and great ambiance. I had the jaegerschnitzel, and it was wonderful.
author: Jeff S.

description: Love this little dive!!!  Before dinner, my wife and I took in a couple local brews at this little gem.   Very cold Anchor Steam was poured to the complete satisfaction of my taste buds.  Very cozy Tavern, which I instantly felt as if I was in NYC.  Many a TV surrounded the bar and lounge area and every so often, you'd hear a trolley car go up the street, then you remember you're not in NYC, but in San Francisco lol.  We didn't eat, but they had a nice menu of items and I can see this place really getting full.  Happy Hour priced food and drink items.  I'd most definitely come back here when in town!!
author: Scott V.

description: Seriously funky find! As we were walking up and down the streets of San Fran we were getting hungry and decided we would wonder in to this fun little dive bar. I loved the vibe. Like a dark dungeon! Felt a little like we were walking in to a modern Game Of Thrones pub. It was Happy Hour so we got some beers and some bites and really enjoyed ourselves here. The music was fun, we sang along to most of the songs, service was nice and speedy, food was rich and fueled us for the rest of our adventure. I'd say obviously it's nothing fancy but it still was good and we really had a great time. I would definitely stop back in the next time we are in San Fran.
author: Ashley S.

description: The last drip tavern has great food, their Mac cheese was solid, however the service could be faster and the decor needs some work, the servers/bartenders are polite and are working as fast as they can however during a rush they are clearly slightly understaffed the drink are standard and a bit pricey but being in downtown SF it's the usual
author: Rubens T.

description: This is an awesome neighborhood bar.  Was staying at a local hotel and the front desk recommended this.  I had the tavern salad with chicken and a happy hour margarita.  I wondered about the flavor of a $5 drink but it was very tasty.  The $5 is for the small glass I think.  The salad was very good- although next time I'll ask for the dressing on the side- the chef had a heavy had this time.  Service is friendly and quick.  I was surprised there wasn't more folks in the bar since the prices are very reasonable for the area and the food terrific.
author: Buzzy B.

description:
Delighted to find Last Drop Tavern. To me it feels like a secret hideaway/nook/cave, and it's just a block off the heart of Union Square.

I partook in and enjoyed these three, which I am listing in order of favorite:

Bacon deviled eggs
Bourbon barbeque ribs
Old-fashioned
author: Camille L.

description:
Not from San Francisco, I stumbled upon Last Drop Tavern after failing to find a chill restaurant that wouldn't blow every last dollar. To be completely honest, I was little unsure because it's a tavern (whatever that means) but it absolutely exceeded expectations. I came in on a Thursday around 7pm to pretty quiet, but still lively restaurant and bar. It's a little hidden and dark on the inside, with castle-like decor.

Because I took myself on a date, I sat at the bar so as not to take a table from someone else. There are TVs behind the bar anyway, so I just watched soccer and enjoyed the peace and quiet. There was an awesome happy hour special - $5 for a margarita! I had 2. I also got the baja fish tacos (3 for $9) and the chips and guacamole ($5). The food was so delicious, tacos covered in savory sauce, and the guacamole was really fresh. My marg was strong but not bitter, nor did I struggle by ANY means to drink them both down. Took my food maybe 10 minutes tops to get to me.

The bartender who was taking care of me was super nice, and attentive that he was not too in my face, but also didn't make me feel like I was forgotten. Overall, it's a great spot for a solo dinner, drinks, and a little quiet. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in SF and wanting to take myself on another date.
author: Jordan B.

description:
I came here with a group of coworkers for Happy Hour, the drinks were ok, but the service was fairly slow. It took us a while to get our drinks, and I was thinking we might have to start ordering doubles. Next time I think I will go to the bar and get my own drinks.

This place offers 7% off your bill via Yelp Cash Back, so I will most likely stop in again and give it another try.

The food was good, I heard many things about the Mac n Cheese, and it lived up to expectations.
author: Bryan M.

description:
The entrees were great! I had the fish tacos, and I would definitely order them again. The location is right by union square which is really convenient. Artichoke dip was just okay... service was friendly and attentive.
The only negative about this place is the setup. If you're looking for quiet and romantic, this is not the place for you. It has a dungeon type theme, and every table is very close to others or in a corner/ by a wall. Just an overall interesting seating arrangement.
author: Sam B.

description:
Fun! Quirky! Little Gem for sure! "Underground" bar with pretty amazing architecture and decor. Our bartender was attentative and efficient, our drinks were perfect. Hubby ordered fish 'n chips, which he devoured! I just had buffalo wings, which were the usual fare, but definitely tasty and done right. Be prepared to walk a very steep street....a calf workout never hurt anybody, right?
Looking forward to going back, I have a feeling this place packs 'em in on weekend nights tho!
author: Michelle M.

description: This place is located 2 blocks from Union Square.  We come here every time we visit San Francisco and we've never been disappointed.  Food is good, the bartenders are friendly especially May who always remember our names even though we only come to the city 4-5 times a year.  The food is excellent.  We've tried almost everything that is on the menu but our favorite is the the buffalo wings and bacon deviled eggs.  My husband loves their beef slider and the crab cake slider.  For a bar food, this place ranks high up there.
author: Retired M.

description:
While visiting San Fran this spot was located next to my hotel the Marriott Union Square.  The drinks were spot on and the food was flavorful, presentable, and quickly served. I had a blood orange margarita and a blueberry lemon drop both were creative and strong libations.  For food I ordered calamari some of the best I've had in awhile. It's was both crispy, lemony, and a perfect touch of zing with the sauce. The service was just as good with an older gentleman keeping everyone satisfied with constant customer service. My eating companions ordered the sliders and soup which they raved about as well except for some reason I noticed the bread stayed on the plate for a couple of the sliders. 

Anyways, this sports bar/ restaurant provide a nice setting with plenty of TVs to stayed tuned into the big games.  Will definitely check it out again next time I visit.
author: Michael H.

description:
A large group of us came here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We were quickly seated. I asked if we could have a split check for each one of us (10 people!) and the waitress kindly agreed given that it was not busy at the time.

We started out with a few drinks. I could not resist a hot cider with some whiskey in it. It turned out pretty good, although I thought they went a little bit too heavy on the booze. For lunch, I ordered mixed greens (was not sure exactly what I was going for, but it seemed like a safe choice). The salad was very good, well seasoned with dressing and just the right amount.

The place itself is quite dark, but has a bunch of TVs on the walls - a typical bar-like setting. Service was outstanding, better than in many fancy restaurants I have been to.
author: Christy W.

description:
A bit noisey and may be hard to find a seat in the evening, gets pretty packed with groups and transients. American food/bar fare. Not much vegetarian options per se and wasn't exactly feeling a salad. I had stopped in for a quick drink and a snack before meeting up with a friend.

I had gotten the fries and a couple of drinks. Tried the old fashioned. Much like other places, not a big fan of anywhere that uses regular ice to make it. Tasted watered down. They do have a decent whiskey selection though so I got those neet instead. The bartender behind the bar likes whiskey so you can have a good conversation if you're interested in that also. The fries were decent, had those with an aioli on the side. 

Might stop in for whiskey again though I'm not sure I'd go again for food given my diet.
author: David C.

description:
We stopped here on our travels through SF. It was close to our hotel and it looked like a great menu. And that it was! 

I got the fresh crab cake sliders with a side of garlic fries. Uhhh yum! Super tender cakes with lots of flavor! We got some bloody Mary's too! Our service was awesome too. The ambience was quaint and candle lit with cool knick-knacks. 

This place was so good, we went back a second time! So I'll have to recommend the fish n chips as well! :)
author: Stevi K.

description:
I ordered Delivery tonight.  The Beef Slider was perfectly cooked.  Fried calamari and Garlic Fries were  delicious.  

My only problem is the plastic containers don't allow the steam to escape so the French Fries and Calamari were a bit soggy.  I popped them in in my toaster oven 
on high heat to crisp them again.  Very tasty and timely delivered.
author: Sandi L.

description: I lived in San Fran for 3 moths for work. Right up the hill on pine. This was my spot for a cold beer.  Happy hour rocked and the food is FN good. Best calamari I have ever had. And the beer was awesome. Good service always while I was there.   Keep it up!
author: D C.

description: I found this place randomly when searching for a bar in the area that has decent dinner options. We came in at around 8:30pm on a Thursday night and easily got a table. The server was very friendly and accommodating. I got the Lollipop for my first drink which was really pretty! For dinner, we shared the California Sliders and Baja Fish Tacos. Both were excellent, and we were surprised how good everything was for just randomly finding this place! You don't often expect to find amazing food at no-frills bars like this but it was on point. I also had a Sazerac for my second drink; really good! This place is definitely worth a try.
author: Pooja C.

description:
Service here was excellent. We came here for dinner and the bartender came over to take our drink order. Hubby told him he liked IPAs and the bartender said, "I'll be right back." Brought him a great beer - didn't even know what it was!

I got the fried buttermilk chicken sandwich. The bun was super tasty, chicken was very moist and coleslaw was a great add to this sandwich. Hubby got fish and chips. He said they were tasty. The fries were meh.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Great Burger!  Perfect. 
Great Fries! Absolutely Perfect!  They aren't warm - they are steaming hot when you bite them...
Good Tunes (lots of Metallica)
Cold Beer!
Playoff Hockey!!!
author: C R.

description: We dropped in for lunch around 1:15p.m., before checking in at our hotel. There was plenty of seating and we were promptly greeted by the bartender, who invited us to sit wherever we'd like. My husband asked the bartender for a local beer recommendation and he wasn't disappointed. I ordered the California sliders and my husband ordered the ham melt sandwich. The California sliders were under the "bar bites" section of the menu and were, truly, just a few bites. But, every bite was delicious! My husband's ham melt was huge and tasted great (I snuck a few bites off his plate, too!). He got the garlic fries with his meal, which were very tasty, but some of the fries were undercooked. Overall, the staff was exceptionally friendly, the bar was well-stocked, and the food was scrumptious.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Great little spot near downtown SF shopping, but far enough and tucked away. It was a random find but was pleasantly surprised. Excellent cocktails, and yes, tried basil gimlet per recommendations from reviews, and it was really good. We also had calamari and fish tacos from happy hour menu, both were solid, cooked correctly, batter not too thick or greasy. 

Would definitely come back for a post-shopping drink and chat.
author: Meerim I.

description:
As an occasional visitor to the city, this spot kind of hits all the quintessential San Francisco hallmarks.  It is kind of hidden, looks like it has been around forever, it is very quirky and is pretty small.

You trudge up towards Nob Hill and then descend a staircase to a cellar-ish spot with lots of TVs for your local sports fix, a fireplace for the cold, cold, summer nights, and an honest to goodness table for 3.  Only is SF do you just build a table into a column that take up one of the spots in what would otherwise be a 4-top.  The drinks were good and reasonable, and the place is dripping with charm, if you are into this type of place in SF.
author: Matt H.

description:
3- ambiance is nice.   interesting location.  interesting interior design.  a bit dark but that is okay.  Multiple tvs to watch games.   
3.  Services.  Great.  Friendly people.  attentive.  might be a 4 but the recommendation of what i ate was so off, knocked a point off the rating.
1. food.   this is where it went to bad.  Asked for recommendations and was told the Jagerschnitzel with mushroom sauce and spaetzle was excellent.  boy was that not right.  the meat was dry and tasteless.  and you know this is the case when they overloaded with the brown sauce (brown sauce is always used to hide bad food).  unfortunately that sauce was also tasteless.  finally i cannot believe that this place thinks spaetzle was to be grilled and serviced last it were hash browns.  just awful.  

the place's name is correct in what it is telling you, go to all of the other taverns first for food.
author: Tim F.

description: I love this place! It's really close by home and I come here quite often. Great spot at Bush and Powell in Union Square with a friendly staff that are on it. Full bar and restaurant with a kinda mid evil theme. I love the jagrschnitzel most but also love the ribs, wings and burgers, everything is good. I order it from the EAT24 app too sometimes. I also come here for Mojitos made by the awesome bartender Mae.They are excellent but all of the drinks are well done with generous pours and 12 beers on tap too, happy hour daily 4-7. Check it out if your in union square, you won't be disappointed. I recommend for food, drinks or both.
author: Pete S.

description: What great find in Union Square. This area has got bad reputation for foods. Every other place is tacky, sanitized or frat house like. This was a real gem. Very mellow atmosphere but let's get to the heart of it - the cocktails were amazing. Mind you am not actually a cocktail person. I usually find them too sweet. But we had the basil gimlet and the bloody orange margarita as recommended by all the reviews and they were great. The food was decent too. I liked the fried calamari. Perfectly cooked and doughed. The fish tacos were ok. They were a bit too much flour. I don't hang in union square much but if I do again would def. top my shipping with some cocktails here.
author: Xiu L.

description:
Awesome bar! A large group of friends and I came here to watch the NBA Finals, Game 4. The place was packed! I was very impressed by our waiteress, regardless with how many people there were, she was very attentive and had a quick turnaround for our food and drinks. A+!

They have a pretty good happy hour, a variety of food and drink specials... $5 for guac and chips, not bad considering a large cup of guac is probably $4.50 of the $5. Other snacks and plates are available as well.... basket of fries, fish tacos, wings, onion rings, spinach dip (all ranging between $4-$9.) They have a full bar and your standard tap list: Lagunitas, Racer 5, Anchor, Guinness, etc.

Awesome place downtown!
author: Marcie A.

description: What a fun experience! My boyfriend and I decided to drop in after an exhausting car ride, and I'm sure glad we did. It looks like a small hole in the wall from the outside, but it's huge inside. We tried the mojitos and guacamole and chips for a small snack. Everything was great. Fun atmosphere, cheap drinks and good food.
author: Jordan C.

description:
This was pretty good! Lovely atmosphere! My server was really sweet! I ordered from
The happy hour menu. I got a sangria and calamari.
The sangria was good and not too syrupy, but it is a very small glass. The calamari was nice, but the ringlets seemed to be chewy to the point where I wasn't sure if they were cooked all the way.
author: Hei N.

description: Place has really good bar eats Igor the garlic fries and the Mac and cheese and it. Blew my tastebuds my girl got the portabelo sandwich and it was so delicious they have many other great options on the menu to try but for what I got this place takes the cake
author: Guillermo R.

description:
I've dropped in here before, and never had a bad experience while sitting at the bar. Last Saturday, C and I decided to drop in here after an evening out (we were staying at the Orchard Hotel, right around the corner).  There was no room at the bar, so we sat adjacent to the door.  It took forever for the server to come by.  And she wasn't very friendly.  We ordered our drinks, and it took a while for them to be served.  And the server never came by again.  We finished our drinks and wanted to go.  But no server.  Finally we could see her standing behind the bar with her back to the room, browsing her iPhone.  C finally got up and told her that we wanted our check.  She came by a couple of minutes later and dropped it off.  I gave her my card right away, but again she disappeared for several minutes before returning with a grumpy face and the check for us to sign.

This was C's first time here and she has said that she will never return.  After that bad experience I don't think that I will either.
author: David W.

description: Comical service it was that bad. Bad food. $14 martini filled 60%, left 40% empty. Served food without silverware, and then ignored for 20 minutes. Then the server waits next to my table to wait for her tip when she drops off the check, and makes a snark remark because I tipped 12%. My second time here, never again. Too many great spots in SF to waste time here.
author: Keagan G.

description: I just had a great experience here! My friend and I were looking for a good happy hour and planned to go to the Tongo room at the Fairmont. That place was not cool. They said we can start with drinks but needed to wait 45 minutes for food? Like they couldn't serve us at the bar seating. We thought it was super weird. So we went in search for a new spot. 2 blocks down and we found this gem. Reasonable price and yummy food:) we basically ordered the whole happy hour menu- fish tacos, pork ribs, fries, guacamole and chips and calamari. We both got muni bottles of sparkling wine. It was a great spread. (No. We were not embarrassed that we totally cleaned it all!!) it was all tasty. The waitress was so sweet and attentive. It completely helped us kick off the weekend. And it definitely lifted up our spirits after the tongo room.
author: Antoinette L.

description: Great happy hour deals and an awesome environment for sports. Food was pretty average pub food and drinks weren't life-changing, but for the price, no complaints. Happy hour deals are just too good. House wines are also great and a safe option! We stayed here for hours!
author: Maansi D.

description: Great bar! We went there because it was walking distance from our hotel. Got a seat right away. Ordered an Ol' Fashion (strong/delicious). Ordered the salmon (not over cooked/delicious). Service was amazing! AND they were playing the game on TV. I would definitely return to this establishment.
author: Chris N.

description:
Loved this bar! Went with a big group from work and we were originally going to another place but it ended up being too crowded. Found this gem on Yelp and they were super accommodating of our 12 people group right away. 

Good happy hour prices on beers and wines - $5 flat price. It did get crowded as the night went on but just goes to show other people like this place too!
author: Celia L.

description: Looking for local place with character, nice spot, comfy feeling. I had the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich with slaw, and the garlic fries. Chicken was great, freshly fried, not frozen with breading. Fries were disappointing, not crispy, not hot, and just some minced garlic spread over them. My server was good though. I would try it again.
author: Stewart G.

description: We visited this place while on a pub crawl. My friends and I enjoyed the grilled cheese bites as well as the sweet potato fries although I cannot say I loved the cinnamon dipping sauce. The atmosphere is nice, definitely good for a date. My only complaint was the service. Our waitress was very slow at bringing our drinks and food. I thought this may be due the amount of people on our crawl but they appeared to be getting served by others.
author: Dequetta D.

description:
Great happy hour, great service, and great mac n cheese, what more can you ask for? Went here on the recommendation of yelp after some shopping, and was impressed. The happy hour has discounted beer, wine, and appetizers (some of which can stand in as a main, i.e. the fish tacos), allowing you to get a fun late lunch/early dinner in with drinks for a very affordable price. 

Over the course of our visits here we've tried most of the happy hour offerings. The top pickings: the fries (thick cut and served with a spicy aioli) and the fish tacos (very good and an amazing deal for the portion size). The boyfriend also liked the wings (they were just barely edged out by the fish tacos because of the portions) and the deviled eggs. The artichoke dip was a little too salty for my tastes, but my friends really enjoyed it. The guacamole was the only thing that really fell short (just not as flavorful as most). 

Although it isn't on the happy hour menu, we also had to try the mac n cheese. Best decision of the meal. First nicety: it comes inherently vegetarian with the option to add different meats for an additional small charge. I hate removing meat for dishes to make them vegetarian--the dish is relying on the meat for flavor and I'm paying for meat I'm not getting--so this set up was a welcome change. But the best part was the cheesiness! Lifting a forkful, you could see the cheese strings stretch to keep your bite attached to the rest of the bowl. It was mac n cheese heaven; you must try this!

We've always been served by a waitress with light blonde hair, though I've yet to get her name. She's always very nice, and the perfect amount of attentive without being overbearing. She also patiently helped us pick beers which the boyfriend and I are still learning to do (we're wine people).

Come check this place out!!
author: Cara W.

description: Laid back place with great food and service.  Order the grilled cheese bites and carnitas street tacos, both outstanding.  Service, brews, and conversation made it worth a return visit next time I'm in the area.  Really dig the vibe and decor at the LD Tavern.
author: Scott B.

description:
Their sweet potato fries are the bomb. Not overly greasy, not overly salty. Just perfect. Make sure you substitute the spicy aioli as the cinnamon aioli is really more for dessert.

Very great customer service. They got us a table when it was crowded during Santa Con without us even asking. Really great preemptive customer service. Our server was also very attentive.

I will definitely come again when I'm in the city.
author: Alvin C.

description:
This place is awesome. It was near our hotel and is open late so we stopped in after our late flight for a drink. They make great drinks (we had martinis and old fashioneds) and their food is surprisingly tasty for having a pub feel. The kitchen does close before the bar does though so keep that in mind. 

We went back before our flight home and the bartender remembered us!  It was game day and so it was pretty busy but we were able to get a table, some drinks, fajitas, and the grilled cheese bites, which come with tomato soup for dipping. 

All in all a great neighborhood spot and I'll be going back next time I'm up north!
author: Sarah H.

description:
Best service, atmosphere, really cool owner, free wifi, comfortable chair, good food and awesome service. Really nice big TVs and many of them if you wanna watch games here. 
For my own selfish reasons, I considered not writing a review so that less people would know about this place :)

1. Drinks
Apple cider with shot of whiskey is amazing. I could drink it every day. So yummy and quite intoxicating, so beware. They have good selection of all beer and liquor. 

2. Service 
Truly great. Cannot even find enough good words to use. Super fast, checks on you enough times but leaves you alone when you need it. Not intrusive but will be there whenever you need something. They are on top of their game! The female bartender/server is simply the BEST!

3. Food
Fries were great. I really like the grilled cheese with tomato soup. All their food is good unlike typical sports bar. 

4. Ambience
Very CLEAN, comfortable, cool decor. Restrooms are clean. Nothing to pick on. Really great. 

5. Free wifi
They have good wifi and during the day, you can have a quiet time of working while sipping beer or apple cider (sounds so innocent) here. 

6. Music is great
They always play really cool music. Classics mostly, Beatles, Scorpion, Red hot chili peppers are in rotation a lot.
author: Bella J.

description:
We came here during lunch time on Christmas weekend. All of the other known restaurants nearby were completely full, and this place was barely visible from the street. We called ahead to see if they had room for 9, knowing the chances were slim. Their response: "we would be delighted to have you".

The food was great, the service very friendly and topped it with a beer. We all loved our visit here and would come again.
author: Yoni L.

description:
We don't drink so we were just there for the food. We ordered calamari during happy hour, it was great. My hub had a delicious fried chicken sandwhich. The chicken was flavorful and moist. I had the chicken curry. It reminded me of English curries I've had when I lived in England. It was a little bland but I spiced it up with tobasco. 
Overall a good experience.
author: Justine W.

description: I agree. Best garlic fries--crisp!  Cheeseburger was perfect. I had the street tacos a few days ago-steak. A tad spicy. My husband likes the fried chicken sandwich on Home made bun. It is a quiet place for lunch near Grace Cathedral.
author: Marie Z.

description: A couple of beers and some sweet potato fries with my sister. What a nice happy hour!
author: Maureen E.

description: A great place for drinks and excellent guacamole especially at happy hour.  The Last Drop Inn also a classic comfortable location. It also has a large regular lunch and dinner menu including sandwiches pastas and large plates such as fish and chips, curry chicken and fajitas.  Last but not least, some of the best background music including Journey and Pink Floyd.
author: Mylin D.

description: Top notch local's dive bar with great food. The bartender Milthon (goes by something else which I can't remember, apologies) was an absolute gem.  Really entertaining, interesting professional with great recommendations and made everyone feel like they were at home.  If you want a fun, non-pretentious spot to enjoy a drink and meet some characters, this is your spot.  I'll be returning every time I'm in San Fran.
author: Ron D.

description:
Lots of big screen tvs and great food + drink. I caught a Warriors game here and there were tvs everywhere. They'll even change the channel for you if you want to watch something else on the tv you're facing (dude asked to change the channel from the Warriors to a Pac-12 game and we were like really dude). 

Anyhoo, service was great! We came here with a larger group late on a Friday night and we got seated right away. My blood orange margarita was nice and fruity. I loved my buttermilk fried chicken sandwich. The batter on the chicken was unbelievably crunchy yet light and I could have fallen asleep on the fresh and fluffy house made bun. I also had a bite of the Last Drop burger which was equally as excellent.
author: Maya S.

description: This is for the fried chicken sandwich and fries. Got them via Eat24 delivery and it was great. The bun was phenomenal fresh, dense and a bit chewy bread. Better than your average bun. The fried chicken was crispy and flavorfully seasoned. The fries that came with it were not thin cut- but not thick cut either. Bordering on too thick for my tastes but really good and unique. Gave it a solid 4, then ordered it again and the bun was a bit stale and this time it wasn't as good overall.
author: Piper W.

description: When you travel you always take a chance on what you will get. I arrived at my hotel to no room ready for me, which led me to this wonderful watering hole. The decor is all over the place from dragons to little angels but the service, libations, and food are awesome. Simple burger and fries really good.
author: Edward B.

description:
Was here with my girlfriend and I ordered the fajitas and she got the quesadilla. I must say that the food was good, but the woman that served us must've had a bad day or she just hates her job. When we got the food we ordered she literally tossed our food on the table. I didn't even get a plate to eat from. Had to use the one she use to serve my guacamole, beans and rice from.
While we ate she had probably got some newly washed cutlery she was putting back where they store them, but instead of being gentle, she basically just dropped them in it's place, making a hell of a noise. 
If it wasn't for the good food I would've given it  1 star
author: Torry E.

description: I'm not sure if I could be more positive about a dinner: bar. Recommendations for food were spot on. May have gave us incredible service. No split fees. Just genuine real service. Food was marvelous .. super happy.
author: Alison F.

description: Fun little hole in the wall with very good drinks & yummy bar food too!  The bartender was great & service was good too.  Stop by if you are in the area.
author: Kim M.

description: What at great atmosphere, such a quaint little stop will up in Union Square!! The drinks were top notch, service and FOOD.  The street tacos are amazeballz!! Me and the hubby will keep coming!!!
author: Jessica G.

description: One of the better meals I had on my SF trip.  After a long day of meetings, I went down the street form the hotel and found this little hole in the wall.  Definitely a very energetic buzz- loud with lots of TVs and a ton of people.  I sat at the bar and the bartenders were super friendly and attentive- got drinks and food quickly.  I went for the mac and cheese with bacon which was some of the best I've had in a while.  It was a huge portion with shells, white cheddar and a few other cheeses blended in for flavor.  It was the perfect meal after a very long day.
author: Greg O.

description: Fun place for a drink but wouldn't eat here. It's not the cleanest of taverns and their wine list isn't great but great location and good prices.
author: Kelly R.

description:
My fiends and I stopped in for happy hour, $5 margaritas and mojitos.

We split the fish tacos, guac and chips, and hand cut fries.  

Fish tacos were bigger than we were expecting, and seemingly more than the tortilla was expecting too as I totally fell part as soon as you picked it up ;) still very tasty. 

Guac was light and fluffy, but needed some lime and/or salt (problem solved via my margarita ingredients). Would not get this again. Chips slightly stale.

Hand cut fries were soft and fluffy on the inside with a great crunch on the outer. Fries came with a tangy chili aioli condiment which straight up delicious.

Didn't get the wings but the people behind us did, looked like a good decision. 

Highlights: Decent bar food, cheap cocktails, medieval decor, friendly/helpful staff.

Would I go back? If I lived in San Francisco, you betcha.
author: Andrea G.

description: Was there 2 days ago with friends for my birthday, last stop before Morton's steak house that was just a couple minutes away. Great drinks and nice atmosphere. The place was full of mostly foreigners, that was nice for a change. Had a great time, would definitely go back.
author: Don H.

description:
Local watering hole. Bomb buffalo wings during HH. Also have ribs and calamari 

Beers on tap for $5 during HH and certain signatures like Manhattans for $5 also.

Definitely check this place out if your in Nob Hill.
author: Cole G.

description:
I was looking for food & drink last night and this place popped up on Yelp. They have a sign that literally says "Food & Drink" on the outside - it was serendipitous!

The kitchen is open until 11pm. Drinks are a tad on the pricier side ($7 beers, $11 margaritas, $10 sangria, etc.) but at least there's variety. 

We had awkward service last night because one lady sat us explaining this other lady would start off serving us but will be leaving to go home soon and called her a brat, or something along those lines. 

Our food and drinks came incredibly fast which was awesome, but there definitely was no efforts for kind service. The "brat" about 15 minutes later came out with her jacket on, obviously about to head out, but came by to collect our signed receipts and to clear the table. Kind of an odd experience on the service front, but otherwise cool place.
author: Kelly G.

description: Killer tart (no sweet and sour here) margaritas. Excellent old fashions with house made cherry's. Friendly bartenders. Great Happy hour!
author: Sara B.

description: Yummy. I had the street chicken tacos, my husband had the buttermilk chicken sandwich and my son had the penne with chicken. Let's just say there was no food left on our plates. Excellent food,  excellent service and a great environment. Would definitely come back. Oh ya, and a nice variety of beer to choose from.
author: Tina O.

description: Mandatory stop while in SF. Super clean, great service, and the happy hour is just WOW. Will be back every SF visit.
author: Jess D.

description: Quick service at the bar from May.  Appetizers are all very tasty (bacon deviled eggs!!).  Nice atmosphere.  Overall, no complaints!
author: Chris C.

description:
After discovering that the Tonga Room isn't open until 5 p.m., my friend and I found Last Drop Tavern on Yelp, which was just 2 blocks away.

We came in on a Monday afternoon around 2, 2:30 p.m. and it was pretty empty -- no surprise there. A tourist couple was the only other customer there enjoying their drinks. The bar tender was super attentive, even after the place got pretty packed around 4 p.m. I think our bar tender's name was Anya (that was the name on the receipt), and all her cocktails were on point -- taste and alcohol. I hate it when I pay $12 for a drink and I can't taste the alcohol in it. 

Pomegranate egg white sour: SO yummy! I've never had an egg white cocktail, but this was really great. I'm assuming the egg white is what gave the cocktail the frothiness. If you like fruity, sour drinks then this is perfect for you.
Oaxacan egg white sour: This one is very smokey/earthy. I personally liked the pomegranate one better.
Moscow Mule: Also really good!
Margarita: Can't go wrong with this! Especially when it's $5 during HH!!

We didn't try any of the food because we ate before, but everything coming out of the kitchen smelled great. Their HH (starts at 4 every day) also has some good deals -- margaritas, sangrias, old fashions and a couple others are only $5! 

I'm so glad we discovered this bar and will definitely be back for the well-mixed drinks (and to try the food)!
author: Doris K.

description: This is a nice bar/ restaurant. It has a nice, dark, and cozy atmosphere. The food is good. Customer service is very good. Based on my previous visits, I really enjoyed the Baja Fish Tacos. It was well made. The Fried fish tasted very good. I also enjoyed their BBQ ribs. The meat was tender and the sauce was tasty. The Last Drop Burger with garlic fries was good. It was made perfectly to order. The garlic fries were delicious. Their desert offerings (chocolate flourless cake, dulce de leche ice cream) were okay.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
Cozy, dark tavern mostly full of tourists. Prices are reasonable. I ordered the street style tacos. Definitely tasted like an English pub's attempt at street tacos. Eh, they went down well enough with my beer.

The atmosphere is what really stands out here. I'd love to pull up a stool at the bar and hang out for a few hours, drink some beers, eat some fries and watch some baseball. I'm sure you'd see all walks of life shuffle through here. And when you're done, you can hop on the cable car and head back to your hotel.
author: Will S.

description: Good sports bar. Very friendly.  Great sliders.  Great sweet potato fries.  Good beer selection.  Fun ambiance.
author: Amy S.

description: Cool lil spot we stumbled upon because of yelp. The drinks are good and they have happy hour on sat!! What!?!? The food is good. The ambience is cool too!come and try I'm sure you won't be disappointed!
author: Alexis J.

description: Excellent selection of quality liquor.  Professional friendly staff.  Fries with an garlic spiced aioli was excellent.  Fish tacos were average but had a great amount of perfectly cooked cod.  And the olympic hockey game between Canada and USA was on.  Pleasurable experience.
author: Trevor R.

description: This was a great little tavern with an excellent burger. I had mine with avocado and cheddar and a side of sweet potato fries. Both were exceptional. Also I had a reasonably priced glass of pinot grigio.
author: Mandy F.

description: Great food and service. Went by this place when we were staying in San Francisco at Union square. Great atmosphere and really enjoyed the place.
author: Ryan H.

description: A nice bar. The food (my one time eating here) was better than typical bar food but not great for a restaurant. The staff was friendly and service was excellent. I'd come back for a beverage and eats.
author: A J.

description:
Getting a little tipsy after a 15 dollar mix drink and a beer pre dinner, we stumbled upon the Last Drop Tavern desperately needing to refuel with some dinner! 
It's what I, Imagine most British/Irish pubs are actually like.. (this comes with no actual experience in this market....but I dug the feel). 
After scoping though the menu, (mostly legit bar food) I settled on a p-bella mushroom sandwich with fries (they could make it vegan). 

I must say the fries were my fave part, perfect blend of crunchy and not to greasy! The sandwich was good too, I dug the bread best! 

Our waitress was good, and the drink selection was pretty great as well! I could see myself hanging here! It's pretty dark and feel kinda like your in a cave, but I dug it.. Not ground breaking, but not heartbreaking either!
author: Patrick T.

description:
Bottom Line: A cozy English-feeling pub on the Powell-Mason/Powell-Hyde cable car line in Union Square.

I really liked the Last Drop Tavern for a late night dinner.  It was dimly lit, quiet and cozy.  Even better, the food was comforting and tasty and the service was perfect.  On a rainy/drizzly night in San Francisco Last Drop Tavern was the perfect place to warm up.  They have a few TVs throughout and the week night crowd seemed to be very low key, which I liked.  I would definitely come back here for beer and a hearty meal.
author: Courtney K.

description:
Cool little place. Excellent service!
It was unseasonably hot, so I  ordered a glass of water. We received a giant green bottle of water, along with two icy glasses of cubes.
Small draught beer selection, but not a wasted tap in the house. I had a Racer 5 and a Mirror Pond. Cocktails are fantastic!
The food is very good. We had soup of the day (Lentil) and shared a buttermilk fried chicken sandwich. Both were excellent! I'm not usually a big fan of lentil soup, but I ate every last drop and even considered licking the bowl, clean. The sandwich was nothing extraordinary, but was very good. 
Laid back vibe and cool music. Oldies R&B and early rock-n-roll, during our visit.
Smoooooth!
author: Charles S.

description:
Wonderful food, drinks (specials), and place to chill.  Came into SF late on a Friday night and was expecting to find everything either packed or closed.  This great place was a short walk from our hotel and we got a great meal and great service.

Recommended:  Fish tacos, crab cake sliders, bacon delived eggs! YUMMY!!!
author: Julie H.

description: I love this place.  Stopped in by chance on a Saturday.  Was warmly greeted and promptly seat by the wonderful Allison.  Ordered the sliders as well was wings.  I can honestly say perhaps the best elders I've ever had and the wings were equally as good.  The best part is that Allison knows the words to England Dan and John Ford Coleys classic song "I'd Really Like to See You Tonight" which means she is basically the best server ever!
author: Paul E.

description: Excellent, attentive, friendly bartenders and servers. The service alone brought me back 3 times in my 2 week trip. Everyone on staff is super friendly and engaging. Food-wise, the portabella sandwich was excellent, wings too. Good beer selection. Love this cozy lil place. Highly recommend. Will def return. Thanks May, Shah and Tatiana!
author: Andy T.

description: This hole in the wall place was great! I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and my GF ordered the portabello sandwich and they were both great. We upgraded to the garlic fries which was bomb and very garlicky! We also ordered some calamari which was fried up to perfection. A nice drink menu and good beers on tap. The service was great, but when I got busy, it seemed like a little too much for the one waitress, but she still did a fairly decent job. Also, in this day and age, no free refills seems like BS, but their place is small and it doesn't look like they have a soda machine on premise, so it came from a can. I'd give this place a 4.5 if I could.
author: Junk M.

description: Stellar scotch and tequila list, solid IPA selection, and great atmosphere. Slide up at the bar, order a drink, and just enjoy the company for a bit...or zone out at the Giants game on TV, whatever. The owner/bartender is happy and ready to engage...or not, it's up to you. Great place to spend the evening or just as night cap.
author: Robert W.

description: We have walked by this place a million times but never went in, but finally- in desperate need of a bloody mary, we popped in for a drink.  While the exterior and signage outside look like it is going to be cheesy inside, it wasn't.  Plus they made a great bloody, and it was on happy hour!
author: Camila D.

description:
Came in while touring and sat at a table. Waitress asked if we were eating or just ordering drinks,we only wanted drinks. The menus were swept away, then the silverware. Then the waitress disappeared. We waited 10 minutes, realized we weren't going to get served, so we left.

I would never recommend or go back.
author: Jenna J.

description: It's great hospitality,drinks, food and conversation.
author: Timothy G.

description: An upscale bar-like atmosphere.  Very good service!  Ordered the macaroni and cheese off the apps menu.  It was amazing!!  Never have I had mac and cheese in a bar and would order again!  Very creamy, piping hot and filling!
author: Danielle P.

description: Not coming back here dark lighting. Lots of tourists. The good food wasn't on the happy hour menu and I got my old fashioned served with a straw. Pork sliders and bbq ribs were really good tho but that's about it.
author: KB B.

description:
I must say, the music here is great! I came here with my friends on Saturday night. After a busy week, we relaxed ourselves in this place.
The atmosphere is pub-style. And the food is delicious. My friends and I are very pleased with this place. Maybe I will come next weekend!
author: Katherine C.

description: Ummm delicious hole in the wall, waitress was great, burger is fresh beef and fresh bun and just delicious, something so simple done so right and so good.
author: Stephanie L.

description: We came up to San Francisco for the Ween show on 9/28.  This was right next door to our hotel.  Dark and gothic, already a good sign.  Place was full of people in Ween shirts  Also a good sign. Nice beer selection.  Always nice to have some Leffe on tap.  We split some deviled eggs with bacon and some wings and some fries.  It was like a pre-show party in there, with everyone making poor decisions in the best possible way.  I'd rather regret something I have done than something I haven't done.  This place was the perfect spot to accomplish these goals. Then we all marched over to Ween and they absolutely killed it.
author: Bart P.

description:
super chill spot among the craziness of union square in SF. this is a location the tourists havent discovered, so it was a nice place to stop in on a sunday afternoon. dark wood interior, leather booths and medieval accents give it a relaxed semi dive bar feel with lots of TVs for the sports lovers. 

our group primarily just drank and had a couple appetizers. the food menu is pretty standard bar fare with additions like fajitas and deviled eggs. im picking up on this trend that SF is really into deviled eggs. 

cocktails were good (shoutout to the "ruby slipper" and a whole section dedicated to egg white cocktails, love it!), service was super friendly. would def recommend for people to stop in and check out.
author: Christina G.

description:
HH everyday 4-7! 

Came here on a whim on Saturday to watch the last half of the Warriors game with a friend after feeling a bit too claustrophobic at the Tap Room. Surprisingly, there was still plenty of seating with patronage that were a lot tamer. We ordered a mix of HH items and an item off the regular menu. 

Guac & Chips: Pretty standard. They seemed like store bought chips, and the guac was lacking that avocado flavor. Can't complain for $5. 
Fish Tacos (3): Battered fish on top of little street sized tortillas. A little too saucy for my taste (it was dripping out the sides and on the verge of making the batter soggy), but pretty good flavor. Fish was fried nicely. 
Cesar Salad: Good salad...fresh romaine pieces with a good amount of Parmesan slices on top. Slices of baguette croutons laid on the side. Good dressing to salad ratio too, considering it was premixed. 

Good place to relax and watch a game without the crowd. Food is pretty good for bar food and for the price. Waitresses were attentive too and didn't snub us when we could't make a decision and sent her back a few times (sorry!).
author: Michelle C.

description: Not typical pub grub. Food was very good for a tavern. Good service and it was clean. Best experience for a pub. Usually places have sticky tables and marginal food but this is the exception.  Surprise delivery of birthday ice cream.
author: Arik H.

description: what can I say, other than we came back twice in the same day !     made the Last Drop an early afternoon stop for a late lunch.      Has a cozy 'pub' feel;  good choices for drinks, draft beers, spirits and cocktails  (satisfied my co-guest who liked his single malt scotches).     lunch choices were more than satisfactory, and priced right.     We're filling time before a wedding reception, watched the Blue Angels, and when other bars didn't open until 5pm, we were back for Happy Hour starting at 4pm at the Last Drop, and enjoyed choices we hadn't made earlier in the day.      On my checklist to re-visit when in the same area again.
author: Mike D.

description: Great atmosphere! Burger was cooked to perfection. Three tacos very tasty, better than Mexican place up the street(taqueria). Service A-plus. Great for a quick bite or after work with friends. Don't overlook this place, great food and prices. Enjoy!
author: Christopher D.

description:
Walk in and be prepare to be wowed. Though from the outside this bar seems dive, the dim, brick-walled interior is dark and sultry, but casual and inviting all the same. 

Solid drink menu, with beers, wine, and lots of cocktails. Happy hour is a pretty sweet deal (4-7 PM) with $5 margaritas, mojitos, sangria, and manhattans. My sangria did not disappoint (and the presentation was adorable btw), and neither did my friend's mojito.

Extensive food menu - with most big dishes ranging $11-15. Lots of vegetarian options. Loved the vegetarian quesadilla, full of yummy veggies and served with sour cream, smoky guac, and pico de gallo. 

All in all, definitely a bar worth returning to.
author: Umeet S.

description: Good happy hour prices and bartender was friendly. Definitely recommend the mojito, it was very refreshing. Good place to come to for a quick bite after work. The chips and guacamole were okay, not recommended for sharing because portion wasn't very large.
author: Victoria S.

description: First place we hit up when we forst got to SF, a lil bar/pub on a hill. You walk in and its like you walked into medieval times with its swords and armor on the walls and you a greeted by a fat king mural on the wall. The food was great small bites where you can share with friends and order as many things as you like. The double beer i think it was called where you can mix beers, we had a geiness and hatd apple cider mix. Im not beer fan hence not knowing how the spell geiness lol but this mix was good, it mellowed out the strong beer taste with the apple. A good spot to stop by for a bite and drinks.
author: Varsenig K.

description: Hubby and I had the Manhattan, Mojito, Old-fashioned, and a cranberry-vodka for $5 each (happy hour). All were tasty and well poured. Also tried the artichoke-spinach dip and deviled eggs. Deviled eggs were exceptional! Highly recommend. Happy hour is 4-7pm.
author: Mackenzie W.

description:
We randomly happened upon this place on a weekday evening. We were looking for a place to watch the game and the bigger places were packed. Last Drop Tavern is on a steep hill above Union Square. 

Clientele- Not sure if it was just this night, but there seems to be a large UK/ Irish influence here. May be the spot for the Brits to come?! Fun!  

Service- Our server was extremely friendly and helpful. 

Atmosphere- Small dive bar with what seems like a niche customer base. We were the youngest people there (30's). They have a few televisions around the place and music playing. Sorta a small space with cramped tables. It wasn't too crowded when we came around 6pm.

Food and Drinks- They have a happy hour special. Guac and chips for $6. Bourbon ribs for $9. 

All in all, we had a good time and were glad we found this spot. It fit our needs for the time being.
author: Joanna L.

description: Cool little tavern in Nob Hill area. Saw this bar a couple doors down from our hotel and stopped in to watch the Cubs/Dodgers game.  We didn't eat, but the food smelled great! No complaints on the pomegranate mimosas!
author: Tambralyn T.

description: Great little place for good drinks and great bar food!  Happy hour is also a must do! Hit this place up... you won't regret it!
author: Jered G.

description: Ordered food for delivery and an hour after our was supposed to be delivered it still hadn't arrived. I called to cancel and they gave no apology or explaination. So frustrating - DO NOT ORDER FROM LAST DROP TAVERN.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Great authentic old SF Tavern. Excellent drinks, food and atmosphere.
author: Robert S.

description: The food was pretty good.  We had the burger and fried chicken sandwich delivered.  I'm sure if we would've dined in instead of take out/delivery it might have translated a little better.  Overall not bad for a first try and quick bite.  Delivery times are true 45-60 minutes.
author: Makina P.

description: Very friendly staff! Delicious food and great drinks. Love the environment, came to visit from Las Vegas and found this place while going to a little comedy nearby.
author: Nina R.

description: A really good dive bar, I stumbled in here while I was waiting for my friends to show up and did not want to walk 10 blocks down the hilly San Francisco. I waited here for myself a Mojito and some hand cut fries. The Mojito was a little on the lite side as it had more of the mix then alcohol , the fries was good as well.
author: Rahul C.

description:
I'll keep it simple...

Cocktails were great! Food was good! Service was amazing...! Really clean bar, a hole in a wall!

We sat at the bar.. Shah, our bartender was on top of it. 

My dude and I, agreed we would be back when ever we come back and visit the city!
author: Audrey C.

description:
On a recent visit to SF, my husband and I stayed at the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental, so this bar was just a few blocks away (although down a pretty decent hill), which made walking back fun. :)

We stopped at this bar several times for after dinner drinks and also had dinner here one night. The food was great and arrive was prompt. I highly recommend the sweet potato fries with cinnamon aioli!
author: Kristy P.

description:
Good atmosphere Good Food if there's no glass in it.  See picture of glass shard found in Chicken Curry.   
It happens but I was shocked when the plate stayed on the table for the rest of dinner. When we were obviously done with all other plates the waitress came and said it would not be on the bill. 
(I had already started writing this).  Waitress asked if I would like another one ?!? Another chicken curry I asked?  They didn't dump out the pot of chicken curry????? How many more dishes went out with glass after that!!!   I hope this is being read tonight before anyone orders it!!!
author: DAVID R.

description: Good happy hour, really cheap actually for SF prices. Very close to Union Square which is a plus. Lots of TVs for sports.
author: Paolo S.

description: What a great find!  Staff makes you feel welcome.  Happy hour drinks and food was authentic German fare.  Very good.
author: Carolyn C.

description: Great spot to take in a game and have a bite.  Friendly staff, good beer selection and bar menu.
author: Chris D.

description:
Wife and I were staying at the Stanford Court on Nob Hill during a weekend trip to SF and were looking for a place to watch the Superbowl.  I checked online for bars near the hotel, and found the positive reviews for the Last Drop Tavern.  This place is right around the corner and about a block and a half down Powell Street from three big hotels...The Stanford Court, the Mark Hopkins, and the Fairmont.  It's an easy walk downhill...coming back up a little more challenging!  We had a great time at this little bar.

First, the people are extremely friendly, both customers and staff.  It's a combination of tourists and locals, but everyone is treated great.  There is a good beer selection on tap and bottle, a fully stocked bar with a nice cocktail menu (Moscow Mule was excellent), and plenty of TV's to allow for a good view of sports wherever you are sitting.  This really isn't a sports bar so to speak, more like a neighborhood tavern that has the games on.  The food menu features a good selection of typical bar bites to full plates, and everything we had (wings, fresh cut french fries, penne pasta with alfredo, steak/chicken fajitas) tasted fresh and was well prepared.  We were extremely satisfied with our drinks, the great service, the fun atmosphere, and the overall experience.

I would definitely recommend the Last Drop if you are staying on Nob Hill or near Union Square.
author: David S.

description:
I went here for lunch, which wasn't altogether terrible, but quite underwhelming. 

The fries are believably hand-cut. The "chipotle aioli" accompanying them is a cooled chipotle dressing, probably straight from a purchased bottle. The crab cake sliders with remoulade start out fine, and become progressively more tiresome to eat. 

Maybe this place is fine for a drink, but other reviews would suggest that the food is good, too: this is not the case. Going here for the food is not worthwhile.
author: John L.

description:
I came in for a quick bite/late lunch on a Thursday.  I sat on the upper tier by the door/window.  Watched the street cars go by.  The staff was nice, the atmosphere bar quiet.  They had wifi.  The drinks were good (I had two Mojitos).  I ate the fish tacos which were fabulous.  Nothing special, but well done nonetheless.  I will be back.

Update: Wrote this review while still sitting here.  Again, I am still here as I update.  The credit card machine went down.  So did the WiFi.  I wanted to pay my bill when I found out :( and was told "no problem, just stop by later and pay me".  Who does that? How trusting! It immediately softened me.  Good to know there are still small town bars with kind understanding staff (maybe even the owner?).  Not only will I be back, the word of mouth I will spread about this place will be infectious. Thank you for a great drink, a great meal....and renewing (to a point) my faith in people.
author: Kelly K.

description: My wife and I were staying at Nob Hill and happened upon this quaint tavern and were pleasantly surprised. Extremely pleasant staff and great food. We went two evenings and met a business man who said he ate there five days in a row. The wings and fish tacos are excellent. This is a nice, comfortable tavern to relax and unwind.
author: Mickey F.

description: Best bar around town!! Huge alcohol list and bar tender was SUPER nice and attentive. Happy hour was kicking and people kept on walking in. Would definitely come back again when in town.
author: Amanda P.

description: They free poor, which is a must for a decent bar.  Mae was fantastic, and very attentive.  The fish and chips were pretty good.  A nice place to hang out.
author: Mark T.

description: Good food. I normally order take out.  They deliver what the promise.  I normally get a veggie quesadilla which is great. Comes with guacamole salsa and sour cream.  I mostly order just to get that but they have a minimum of 25 so I get random stuff besides that.  I'll order from them again.
author: Nick S.

description: Stopped here with my wife to have a drink before our dinner. LOOOOOOVED it. Their beer selection is great! Even had a sour which I'm really into at the moment. We also got guacamole and chips + spinach artichoke dip on their happy hour. Both FIRE! Best vibes, best look, even good music playing. A spot and memory we'll take with us back home. AND the manager gave us GREAT recommendations for dinner and breakfast. We had THE BEST dinner at "Cesarios". A+
author: Sean K.

description: This bar has amazing happy hour. Actually let me get into it some more, this place has AMAZING bacon deviled eggs and bourbon bbq ribs! Came here with my group on Monday for happy hour and had the best time. Its located on a fairly steep hill a couple blocks from Union Square San Fran and sunken down from street level but its not one to miss! Their happy hour list consists of those mentioned plus baja fish tacos and buffalo wings. Our server was very attentive and was very generous on every drink pour (yeah, they were really strong drinks) especially the redbull vodka but definitely a bang for your buck! Would come back if ever in town.
author: Tien N.

description: Found this place while in the city and had a great time. Nice bar, really nice bartender, and great selection on beers. We were encouraged to try the food from the gentleman next to us at the bar, but we were just there for a drink...ended up having 4! It was the drink, but also the music, and whole feeling to the place, that made us stay.
author: Alexandra L.

description:
From the manager to all the servers - a great local bar/restaurant.  Great place to watch sports and enjoy a beer from the tap.  Great happy hour EVERY DAY.  But prepare to walk up the steep hill on Powelll . 

Secret:  Try their bread pudding -it's to die for!!!!!!!!'
author: John K.

description: Stumbled into this place on the way to the Tonga Room. The "HH Daily 4-7" sign got us :) We in this thang on a Saturday at 430. Got two seats at the bar. Mae & the manager took care of us the whole time. Great service. Great atmosphere. Great HH!!! Got full of margaritas, fries, chips and guac, and really good bread pudding. More than happy to be spending money in a place like this with great workers, than the Tonga Room.
author: Jessica T.

description: This quaint tavern is an absolute must when in San Francisco. The atmosphere is soooooo inviting and friendly. Best food we had in the city. Prices are very fair and the service is exceptional. Despite the flood of people in and out of this establishment, Alison not only remembered our beverages of choice, but what brought us there on visit number one. Never have we experienced such a genuinely friendly, intelligent, and gracious server. Way to go Alison and Last Drop Tavern.
author: Lori F.

description:
friend orders a drink.
friend was offended that she didn't get carded.
i laugh at her embarrassment.
i order a drink.
i didn't get carded.
we both lose.

$5 beer during HH. great service.
author: Linda N.

description: This place is awesome. Here for 4th of July. This place treated us like queen and king. Manger, bartender and waitress awesome.  Can say enough. Love this place.
author: Gaby T.

description:
This is one of those places where you go if you want some fancy high end cocktail... with so many high end labels it's hard to choose. There are a lot of martini glasses floating around with a cocktail list, items I'm sure you've never heard of. 

The food... I'm really big on the quality of beef. And I'll have to say I loved the hamburger sliders with Cheddar cheese, caramelized onions, and bacon aioli.  And for something I never order ....ribs. OMG they are great zesty sauce. To top off all the deliciousness I had their 'Buttermilk fried chicken sandwich' Yummmmm-ie!  The staff always makes me feel welcome and ensures my satisfaction.  Thank you! XOXO
author: Stacy P.

description:
The waitress is nice 
the restaurant is clean
The food is good and fresh 
I ordered the fajitas and I would come back
author: Kelly A.

description: Old school meets Nob Hill. Amazing happy hour from 5 to 7pm. Incredible deviled eggs. Incredible manhattans and old fashions mixed with steaks and seafood round out the menu. Friendly staff, too.
author: Peter R.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of straight American food, so maybe my review is negatively biased. The service took a very long time, but the food was decent. I got a burger and the chicken sliders. They were good - I was hungry and they got the job done. 

I wouldn't say these were the best burgers I ever had. The place has some cool medieval swag. Expensive for the quality to be honest with you.
author: Vernita G.

description: As a bar I would rate it higher and as a restaurant I would rate it lower so I averaged them out for three stars or Meh! The space is cool if you overlook the dead animal parts on the wall. It manages well with it's dark basement location to be comfortable and welcoming. The staff are mediocre at best and take your order and bring your food without much conversation. The food is their weak spot. The Chicken Sandwich which was recommended was just a step up from fast food with the surprising exception of the homemade bun. The coleslaw was mixed, it added some flavor but ruined the bun. My dining partner got the steak. It's a poor cut and wasn't bad nor good. The garlic fries were worth the $1 upcharge. The hand-cut fries were crispy on the outside and soft and hot on the inside. I was disappointed they did not come with the aioli mentioned on the menu though. Overall it was a disappointment but we left full.
author: Bill B.

description: We went here on my birthday and sat at the bar top, the bartender who I believe is the owner, was very nice and polite. We had the calamari, we asked for aioli with our calamari, it was absolutely delicious. They have Leffe blonde on draft as well which is so good! My husband and I shared a burger, we added bacon bleu cheese, and caramelized onions and it was absolutely delicious. The food here is way better than any other bar I have ever been to.  I also enjoyed how dim it was inside the establishment. It's a great place for day drinking!  Next time we are in the area we will be sure to stop in and grab another burger!
author: Nöelle D.

description: This place was located around the corner from the Orchard. We happy houred here and it was great! $5 whiskey drinks and others. We liked it so much we came after dinner on our way back to the hotel. Didn't eat but great alcohol available.
author: Ashleigh J.

description: Came here because of the Reviews on yelp. Was not disappointed!  Best Bloody Mary EVER!  Our bartender added horseradish and it was delicious. The honey basil vodka gimlet was also very good. Not too sweet....felt like I was drinking a great healthy juice drink   Had the fish and chips and bread pudding. One of the best bread puddings I've had. I usually like raisins but didn't miss them with all the candied walnuts, ice cream and  sweet drizzles. My compliments to the chef!
author: Angie T.

description:
*THIS IS A GLUTEN-FREE REVIEW!*

Anyone who has celiac knows: it's hard to find good bar food...let alone ANY bar food that you can actually eat.

So I was staying at a cute lil hotel in the city with my sister while she out visiting and I just really wanted some good bar food for dinner along with a cocktail.  It's hard to find a bar that you can also eat at [safely] when you have celiac.  But guess what?  YOU CAN HERE! 

We initially walked in because I saw that they served tacos (on corn tortillas) and I thought, "hey, that sounds good, and tacos are usually safe, so why not."  So right off the bat I ordered a margarita and it was reminiscent of what my friend serves at his bar-- he literally owns the place-- in San Diego, and he makes a mean margarita, my friends.  Then I saw fajitas on the menu and I ordered that instead, with chicken.  The fajitas were hot 'n juicy.  It came with corn tortillas, rice, and pinto beans, and gosh durnit, if I didn't lick that plate clean you can call me Sally.  [to be clear, my name is not Sally]  Ok, so the fajitas aren't anything earth-shattering.  It doesn't have exceptionally unique flavors that make it "sing," or anything like that, but it was good, comforting, nourishing, yummy food and I enjoyed every bite.  (and didn't have a lick of indigestion, let alone any celiac symptoms:)  Delicious food, safe for a celiac...at a bar! :D 

For the non-celiac folk:  my sister had a chicken caesar salad, fries, and a screwdriver, and she enjoyed everything she consumed as well.  (I have to say, that salad and fries looked very good, but luckily I wasn't having any food envy with what was in front of me!)

The kicker is the fact that this is a cool, chill, comfy, down to earth joint, with really warm and friendly staff.  I'm an East Bay girl, but if I'm ever in Union Square again (a high likelihood, to be sure) I will totally hit this place up again.  GO HERE!  And order some Mexican food with your cocktail-- you won't regret it, fellow celiacs:)

Thank you, Last Drop Tavern, for the great food, service, and atmosphere!  I look forward to many happy returns.
author: Teenie J.

description: Interesting medieval-themed bar. Dark and dim but kinda cute and cozy with the different types of seating so you can feel like sitting at the bar and watching the game on TV or chilling with some friends on the couch. My friend was staying at the Orchard Hotel just around the corner, so we popped into Last Drop for a glass of wine and a catch-up session. The TVs were not too loud, the service was satisfactory, and of course the wine was great. Nothing too special about this bar, but I had a good experience nonetheless. Awesome that they serve substantial food here so I would come back for that reason.
author: Stefanie C.

description: lollipop martini was delicious. salad with pears was decent. the sliders were very good. would go again. our server tatjana was great, ask for her
author: Michael P.

description: The waitress was very nice but she needs to write down orders. We asked for chips instead of the bread that came with the dip we ordered and it came out with bread. We also asked for a cheese burger with meat, cheese, and bun only with garlic fries. The plate came out with regular fries and there was no cheese on the "cheese burger"
author: Carrie H.

description: Of all the places I have eaten at in San Francisco, this place is the absolute best! The food is pretty consistent, although once the beans that came with my fajita were sour. Other than that I love the food. I went there in person with a friend once and the service was impeccable.
author: JJoyce R.

description: Worst service I've ever had.  Felt like food would never come and after multiple inquires they finally said it wasn't put in.  Crazy.
author: Joshua R.

description: This is one of those places, where you have to read and consider all of the reviews.  Many reviews warned us of the poor service, but the overwhelming visitors said good things.  Our experience was definitely the first.  We walked in around 8pm to have a late dinner after a busy day and immediately knew we made a mistake.  It was a seat yourself place and within 5 minutes we met 3 people - likely the manager (older gent), the bartender, and our waitress.  All were very short, rude, and not friendly - almost like they were doing us a favor. We ordered drinks and received menus.  We could not get a recommendation out of anyone, so we started with grill cheese dippers for our appetizer - they were good!  Then ordered fish and chips and California sliders for our entrees.  Both were average at best. Also to tell you the type of place you are dealing with - they charged one of us for a soda refill. Beers were cold and as you know hard to screw up  Guinness!  The place is dark and if you were trying to dodge the world and have a beer by yourself late at night, this may be a good place. But for dinner, so many great places in San Fran, I would skip this dungeon.
author: Jeff M.

description: We arrived in San Francisco and were looking for a quick bite to eat while waiting for our hotel room. We spotted the Last Drop from the intersection and thought we would swing in. I had the beef sliders, boyfriend had the grilled cheese bites (add bacon) and we both shared the garlic fries. Beef sliders were some of the tastiest I've ever had. Not over cooked and super flavorful. Boyfriend said his grilled cheese bites were absolutely awesome with the multiple cheeses and bacon. He also really liked the "tomato soup" because it wasn't your traditional soup (which he isn't a fan of). He said it more tasted like a tomato sauce of some kind. The garlic fries were outstanding. The fries were super crispy but not even the slightest bit burnt. The sauces they gave with them were on point too. We would definitely recommend!
author: Steph H.

description: I ordered food online, and  not sure if there was a glitch in the system, but it took 2.5 hours to get our food, and I was underwhelmed at how it tasted. My chicken was rough and pink. But they did send us bread pudding and ice cream as a sorry (I think) for the delayed order. I'm not sure I'd eat here again. Maybe the bar scene is better.
author: Brea K.

description:
"You're the first to complain."

Yeah, and? The Stella Artois was strangely metallic-tasting and flat. The manager confrontationally standing over me sneering and demanding I taste a second pour of skunked Stella after my husband and I both tasted my drink and found it lacking didn't change my opinion of its skunkiness. 

The cherry on top of this sadsack service sundae was the manager loudly and rather rudely demanding to know if I still wanted it or not after forcing me to taste it in front of him and stomping away without a word when (obviously) I said no.

Thankfully there was a boisterous gaggle of Brits next booth over drinking Guinness, which prompted me to switch over to that dark beer lover of my youth. I doubt they would have put up with putrid Guinness, so I was happy to have that vote of confidence.

The Last Drop as a bar is small but pretty. The place actually smelled nice, and had a surprising surplus of antlers on the wall. Weird sort of haphazard seating warranted by a small and oddly shaped interior, it came off as cozy and comfortable.

The bacon deviled eggs were basic deviled eggs with a pinch of bacon and scallions on them. Nice enough, but we expected something a little more interesting, maybe bacon-wrapped?
