The street tacos had some kick from the salsa, and good cilantro coverage. The guacamole and chips were nothing special, bland with cheap bulk chips. Overall a decent middle of the road experience marred only by the tantrum from management.

(Oh and FYI - I've had to send a beer back a total of 2 times in the past decade, this being the second. Check your draft lines for contamination guys!)
author: Emily H.

description: Pretty cool little place.  The food is good, they have a nice variety of well-made drinks, and the decor is fun.  I like hanging out here from time to time when Im in  the area.  The service is maybe not the friendliest, but that is a small gripe with a place that has some character.
author: John D.

description:
I went here for a quick drink celebrating my dad's birthday. Funnily enough, the bartender (possibly owner?) and the guy sitting next to my dad all shared the same name! In any case, the bartender helped us take a picture outside with Powell Street in the background, and then offered to us to come inside to have a drink. After finding out about the special day, he gave the birthday boy a glass of whiskey to celebrate, and then served us up our drinks. We maintained pleasant conversation the entire time, and the entire experience was quite enjoyable! We didn't order any food since we were only there for 20 minutes or so, but I can say the drink selection was extensive and expensive. Many of the drinks were 7 or 8 dollars. 

Besides the expensive drinks, everything else was good. The environment was really well-decorated and had a great British feel to it. The service was prompt and courteous, and the bartender engaged in friendly conversation and practically brought us in off the street. It was nice! I'd definitely recommend the Last Drop Tavern to friends.
author: John B.

description: We had great experience and amazing time at this bar. Food was awesome we had fish and chips and Chicken Fajitas. Our server Tatiana was absolutely amazing, we will definitely come back. Good job guys!
author: Miriam S.

description: Husband loved the fish taco's.  The sweet potato fires with the cinnamon aioli sauce tasted like a desert. Great lunch place to go to.
author: Dalene B.

description: Dark, mysterious, rife with the ancient pseudo history of English medieval monarchy, this tavern was everything you might need when you've given up on Powell Street. Granted, I had to leave work like two hours early to make the most of their happy hour deals (4-7), but if you don't find that special happiness that lies buried underneath the pungent aroma of alcohol, well then have a drink from a different menu. Regardless, was it a good time? Yes. Did I actually get fooled into believing I was in a real mid 12th century tavern, at the dawn of the Crusades, awaiting on the return of my knights? Sadly, no.
author: Parker K.

description:
Ambiance: Divey, darkish, but kinda cute.  Not sure what vibe they were going for...American...Pirate....Sports....Dive bar?

Food: Ordered the grilled cheese bites with the tomato soup to dip that sh!t it's SO GOOD - hands down best thing we ordered. 
Chips and guac - good but seriously how do you even mess this up. 
Chicken street tacos - would pass....not good.  Little dry squares of chicken, not much else at all on the tacos. Sad naked chicken square tacos.  I drenched mine in Tapatio and it was reminiscent of college but in a bad way. 

They have a happy you until 7pm by the way, some apps and drinks are a few dollars cheaper, $5 wine yo!!!

Side rant: I had kind of a strange experience here with servers that were OVERLY attentive.  It was the kind of attention you might expect at like a $$$$ restaurant or a 5 star restaurant, not a little dive bar in San Francisco.  I'm not sure why either, but they were literally checking on us every 3 minutes. Not even exaggerating.  My friend and I both confirmed with each other afterwards it felt over the top, and was getting in the way of us having a flowing conversation....so strange why they were that attentive unless they were trying to get us to leave or something who knows lol. 

I'd come back for the melted cheese bites and $5 HH wine.
author: Christina L.

description:
We stopped in for the TENTH INNING of the Cubs/Indians World Series 2016- WOW! First of all the fans were great, but the food was off the chain!
I had Boubon BBQ Ribs & I couldn't have been happier. My husband had the fish & chips and while we have had better, we have certainly had worse. They were good sized & battered well.
The ribs were sweet with a spicy finish & came with creamy cole slaw topped with a pile of fresh chopped jalepenos- Yum!
The atmosphere is cozy & that night a bit loud. I loved the experience.
author: Holly W.

description:
Found this place by accident.  Felt right away at home - crowd mixed young, old, and all in between.  Old school tavern meets modern clientele - you want a drink at the bar; or you want a dinner at a table serviced by wait staff  - both can done here.
Menu - You want regular bar food go somewhere else.  There is a full  menu that should please most.
Atmosphere - felt like I was in a modern speakeasy where I knew the owner...
Service - excellent.
Price - reasonable for being in a major city.
author: Gary S.

description: The beer is cheap and the food is good. Not a whole lot more to say. Looking forward to my next visit.
author: John C.

description: We had lunch here and it was a nice place to relax with friends, eat some good food and have a few drinks. Don't go if you are in any hurry at all - service was incredibly slow. The gentleman helping us was friendly and kind (may have been the owner), the gal seemed pretty unhappy to be at work. Burgers were good, caesar salad was great! Drinks are stiff...bloody mary was good. The atmosphere really feels like you are in an old English Tavern - dark but cozy.
author: Jill K.

description:
My family decided to wing it for our trip to SF and we ended up choosing this place. The food was alright, but most certainly overpriced. But being in SF, what else could you expect? The waitress was extremely rude to me and my sister. She didn't write down any orders. She messed up my sister's order, giving her sweet potato fries instead of normal fries. When my sister asked about it, the waitress said "hmmm are you sure??" in  condescending manner as if my sister was incapable of remember what she ordered and it was her fault. The waitress did not even offer to make her the correct order.
My sister who is vegetarian, got the Portobello Mushroom Sandwich. She was happy about the vegetarian option. She enjoyed the sandwich itself, but not the sweet potato fries.
I got the Black Forest Ham Melt, which was a bit of a disappointment. The apples were mushy, almost like apple sauce. The ham was dry.
author: Gretty T.

description: Great food and fast service, especially when we wanted a quick meal after having spent a whole day walking over 17 miles in the city.  My husband loved his fish and chips while I enjoyed the daily soup and chicken wings.  We will be back!
author: Annie L.

description: 5 stars are a thing of rarity on Yelp but a must at this bar.  Food is absolutely on point but the service...oh boy immaculate!  Really, am i that special?  The manager here know what its all about...forget $$$ and anything else superficial...this guy is a real person that cares about how oth er rs ferls when they are in his establishment.   So happy i dropped by here.  Sliders are the bomb!  Im a BIG fan!!!
author: Dan S.

description: Great service, excellent bartenders, good beer selection and delicious food.  All you could ask for.
author: Michael G.

description: Maybe it was because I placed a food order for delivery, so the quality diminished in transit, but my food was disgusting. I had the Battered Fish and Chips plate. The fish and fries were soggy and the cole slaw was warm. I could barely manage to get it down.
author: Anette B.

description:
It was amazing, there's not problem about the time for service. And absolute the bartender she was really faster than any service in other places. 

Nice place nice everything people all about that place it was pretty nice.
author: Lester P.

description: The bar tender did not know how to make a margarita. It was not even worth the happy hour price.
author: S H.

description:
We had a great time at the Last Drop Tavern! 
Like other reviewers said, the happy hour has a great selection. Our server, May, was attentive and had great recommendations for dinner. She also had our backs as happy hour drew to a close ;-). I had the chicken curry...it was fantastic!! Salad was yummy...we will probably head back before we leave San Francisco. Ambience was there...looks like both locals and tourists are customers. Great place and cannot say enough good things about May and the Last Drop Tavern!
author: Terri P.

description:
I love the food (especially the Buttermilk Chicken Sandwich), the Last Drop has a geeky-midevil feel, the bartenders are Ok -- I watched them obviously over pour a couple of customers drinks... A whiskey sour for example does not take an 11-count. 

Still, I love the place... I can't wait to come back.
author: Dustin E.

description: Good food. Happy hour every day. Mae, the daytime weekend bartender, is sweet and she gives good food recommendations. The place is up one steep block on Powell--just one--but that's enough to separate it from Union Square and give it a locals feel. Pub-style atmosphere. I find it very relaxing.
author: Nathan F.

description:
Pretty awesome place. Decent beers on tap. Mostly local NorCal beers. I had the fried chicken sandwich and it was full of calories and flavor. It was fresh and had a good flavor. The coleslaw on the sandwich added to the texture quite nicely.

Pretty happy I found this place on a great day in SF.
author: Eric B.

description: We had a really good time at this tavern. I had a black and blue, always good. My husband had the old fashion. The ambiance was cool and different. We decided to get something to eat. I had the burger. Comes on in house made bread, little heavy but good, meat tasted fresh, and was cooked as ordered. It wasn't the best burger I have ever had, but it was good and it really hit the spot. My husband had the fried chicken sandwich. It was good too, also comes on the house bread. Our waitress was super nice! I think her name was Allison. She was very attentive, and when our food had apparently taken a while (though we hadn't noticed, honestly) she was so apologetic and made sure is was delivered with haste. She really took care of us and made us feel welcomed. Right in the middle of our visit a pub crawl came though and it could have easily derailed the service by the sudden surge of customers, but she was great and never missed a beat. This place is bookmarked for future SF trips.
author: Michelle S.

description: Love them. We are from Portland and they were so excited to see us. We stayed across the street and stopped by nightly. They even treated us on our last night in town. We will be back. Love this spot. Sliders are amazing and ruby slippers by fave!!!
author: Chris R.

description: The food and service gets five stars. However, the clientele is extreme loud and obnoxious! Not sure if we'll return based on the clientele.
author: Tony P.

description:
Without a doubt, the worst delivery food experience I've had in SF. It took them almost 2 hours and a half to make the delivery, and when it arrived it could not have been colder, it feels like the food spent the 2 and a half hours in the trunk of the car.

Besides being cold, the quality was simply not good enough for the price. A chicken sandwich with three times more bread than chicken. More than $30 for almost nothing. Never again.
author: Antonio H.

description: Love this place! First time here!! I was just here for cocktails and they were delicious.I need to come back and try the food
author: Theresa G.

description: Second time in 2 days.  Great small bar atmosphere - on our first visit there was a group of 30 that showed up without warning.  The only wait staff on was May and the Shebli .  Even with the crazy business they managed to keep up with all the orders.  I ordered the bread pudding and it was the best I have ever lasted. The grilled cheese bits were tasty as well.
author: Kirsten T.

description: What an amazing meal and great atmosphere. I had the steak and it was one of the best steaks I've had in a long time. My companion had the mac and cheese and said it was excellent. Tried the Irish cider which was drier than most American ciders but an excellent choice. The service was suburb and the noise level was nice. Not too loud so you could carry on a good conversation.
author: Sue C.

description: The chicken sliders here are yummy, lots of food options, nice low key vibe. Love the english pub feel to this place too.
author: Christina L.

description:
So strange how I've never been here before (considering the fact that my boyfriend used to work around the corner from this place!) I went on a Wednesday night and to my surprise, it was pretty packed. It's a bit of hassle getting here because it's on a steep hill off of Powell & Bush. 

My boyfriend and I came right before happy hour ended. The man who seats you, his name is Shipley. Really nice guy and easy going to talk to. Once I got seated, he offered to remove my coat for me! 

On the tables, they only have the HH menu, cocktails, wine, beer and small plates and bites. If you're looking for a meal definitely check out Yelp and other Yelp reviews on what to order. We got the HH chicken wings and the clams (which come in a soup base and bread on the side). 

Drinks - blood orange margarita for me and my boyfriend got a stout beer. Was definitely good, but I'm a gal who likes well blended and mixed drinks, so I'm open to try other drinks when I come back! 

I recommend this place if you're near union square or by downtown. Take a taxi or uber if you don't like walking up a hill, and parking is street but there is a garage in front of Grant Hotel that's easy to get to.
author: Maellene D.

description: Stopped in for a break from sightseeing and the Black Forest ham sandwich with melted Brie, caramelized apples was delicious. Great draft selection, bartenders and staff also outstanding.
author: Jon H.

description: Very nice staff, great food and loved the ambience.  The happy hour prices were very reasonable too.
author: Deborah B.

description: Cool place with a low key vibe. Standard bar fare but I didn't eat just grabbed a beer. Beers range from $5 to $8 but they do a happy hour 4-7. A comfortable place to have a drink for sure!
author: Mike M.

description: Came here yesterday on Thanksgiving and was happy to find a low key bar in Union Square. The interior is very cozy and has almost a medieval type of decor. Dimly lit but it was relaxing. They have a really good happy hour from 4 to 7 I believe. $5 for draft beers, house wines and a list of cocktails too. They have bar bites during happy hour too, we got the spinach and artichoke dip and it was good. Wish it came with more bread, there was a lot of extra dip leftover.  Good deal for the area, not overly touristy either. Will definitely come back when I'm in the area.
author: Jessica G.

description: The ambiance is nice. It can get crowded and not so comfy. I tried three drinks; the blueberry lemon drop, blood orange margarita and lollipop martini. I returned the blueberry lemon drop because it didn't taste like a lemon drop martini. I swapped my blood orange margarita because it was SALTY. I partially enjoyed the lollipop martini. It didn't have any alcohol, but it was tasty. The wings were ok but overpriced.
author: Meagan M.

description: This place is great. I live at California x Powell and come here at least once a week. Best Manhattan and deviled eggs in town. They servers are all super sweet, and the owner/manager is a great guy, if a little rough around the edges at first. The food is surprisingly good for a Tavern. I bring friends here all the time and would highly recommend this place to others.
author: Jason L.

description:
I was out in San Francisco on a business trip, and got out there later in the evening around 8 or so. I came in and the hostess welcomed me immediately and I sat at the bar. 

The second I sat down I was treated like a king. I was talking with the bartender about what beers were good, they had just gotten, and her recommendation. Drank a great North Coast brew while wondering what I wanted to order. In the meantime, an older gentleman (who I'm assuming was either the owner or manager on duty) had come up to me and asked if I needed anything. 

I ordered the fish tacos and some sweet potato fries (my muse) and had them in front of me in next to no time at all. Prior to that I had finished my beer and the owner/manager had instantly got back to me and asked if I wanted something else. I ordered an old fashioned cocktail and it was pretty good compared to the others I've had and it was probably the best priced one for what I got too. The fish tacos were great, the filets were large compared to the tortilla but who complains about too much meat? The fries were excellent also.

After finishing my dinner and my old fashioned, the owner/manager again came up to me almost immediately and wanted to know if i'd like another. We checked my tab so I was sure I had the funds and I asked for his recommendation. He actually recommended their blood orange margarita which was hella good. I was happy about that because it wasn't some uber-expensive drink recommendation, something simple and enjoyable.

The drinks and food here were top-notch and priced just as well. I will happily be returning here again the next time I'm in SF. I get that because I was a party of 1 I got faster service but no one else in the place seemed to be waiting on anything or complaining either. This place is great!
author: Ryan H.

description:
Decent food with mediocre service. I had the Black Forest ham sandwich with sweat potato fries, nothing to write home about but not bad. Service was slow but when the server was present it was almost like he was trying to hurry me along even though the place was less than half full. 

No real complaints but probably won't be back. And be prepared for the extra SFHO tax.
author: Andrew B.

description: Great little tavern, with dark soft lighting. It's never too crowded and the staff is always on top of their game. I wish you stayed open till 2 AM!
author: Krystal S.

description: We stumbled upon this place by accident!  Good thing- they have a good happy hour, great bartenders, & fantastic drinks!  The appetizers we tried were yummy as well.  Don't let the exterior fool you- looks like a dive bar from the sidewalk.
author: Katie S.

description:
Bear in mind this place is a pub and the review will be treated as such.

Food quality,  good
Speed of kitchen to table, VERY good,
Price - (was here during HH) 2 apps entrees and cocktails, all fair prices.
The one thing that bugged me is that I saw the apps sitting on the counter for almost 5 mins. Wanted to grab it myself but was unsure.

Didn't realise until later it was because there was only one waitress for the whole establishment at that time. She was kept pretty busy. Thanks Mae.
author: Sunny Z.

description: Cozy hole in the wall spot just on the outskirts of Union Square at the top of a hill :)   Welcome to San Francisco.   DIdn't try any food here as we just popped in for a nightcap.  Had an english feel and menu.   Staff was attentive and nice.   Wide variety of beer/wine/alcohol selection and reasonably priced considering the area.
author: Courtney T.

description:
Made a last minute reservation on a Friday night, and the staff was very accommodating. I arrived at 6:50pm and the waitress suggested that we order things quickly to get the happy hour menu, and even gave us extra time to order at the happy hour prices!
The crispy chicken sandwiches were amazing, and their fries are super legit. Not too oily and definitely actually hand cut! Love them
The waitress made a mistake and served us something wrong but immediately came back with the right plate, gave us the first plate as service, and apologized.
Good was great, atmosphere was great, service was great, and the drinks were reasonably priced and great as well!
author: Grace P.

description: It was okay place, drinks on tap were priced correctly $5-$7 for beer. The mixed drinks were slightly pricey but that is the average around there. I ordered sliders which took over 15 minutes when there was only 2 customer in the whole place none who were eating. They lose a star for that. Overall ok, I wouldn't go back unless I was working around there.
author: Player L.

description: Food was honest. Service was ok. Not a brilliant place, but they fed us last minute on Xmas eve, when everyone else was either closed or full.
author: Inaie R.

description: Good solid choice for bar food. We had an early morning flight (6am) and wanted something good but quick. We stopped in here and it was nice. The sliders are my suggestion- both the California and the Beef were good. The chips and guac were pretty good as well. However, I don't recommend getting a mixed drink - stick with beer.
author: Matt C.

description:
This was a great place to begin our San Francisco experience , the staff is amazing , just as well as the food and wide selections of drinks. Friendly atmosphere and welcoming.

If you love a happy place and smiling faces , this is the place that must be on your list when you come to San Francisco.

Cheers and visit this okay if you are in town !
author: Samir M.

description: Little dark, but its just the place you want to find yourself at the tail end of a bad week. I can't remember the bartender's name, but he's adorable, french and makes a decent Old Fashioned.
author: P F.

description:
This Tavern is definitely more than just a bar! The food is that kind of really good-hits the spot-craving it later type of food. Buttermilk fried chicken sandwich- amazing. Mac n cheese with bacon- hearty and creamy and on your mind later too! 
They have a nice selection of local beers on tab as well as imports you would like to find at a tavern. However, the craft cocktails really shine! Try the sours. Any of them! All amazing! And can't go wrong with any of their crushed iced mules, your choice of vodka, mezcal or bourbon. Blood orange margarita? Yes please! 
Right in the heart of the city and a cozy and comfortable, yet refined vibe, I find myself here almost every weekend!
author: Yvette G.

description: Stopped in for happy hour and was not disappointed.  Happy hour prices are the best in town.  Had an old fashioned and boy was it strong!  Their sliders were delicious and the service was great.  I'll definitely be stopping by whenever I'm in the area.
author: Elizabet L.

description: The calamari appetizer was awesome, tender without a hint of that overcooked rubber you often get.  The fish and chips serving size was generous, but the fish was a bit oily.
author: Mike P.

description: Cool little sports bar that plays classic rock. Relaxed atmosphere, except the server was a bit hasty. The pear Gorgonzola salad was nice. The seating is unique because you can sit at the bar, at tables, or little nook type boothes.
author: Gretchen H.

description:
Shibli is the man. 

Needed to waste some time before I could check into the hotel.  Some bars looked sketchy, so I stumbled on in to last drop tavern.  Quiet, nice, underground feeling.  Got an awesome Moscow.  Came back later that night.

Shibli is awesome and makes whatever you want.  If you want time to slow down and relax- this seems to be a nice place to unwind from the craziness of the city.
author: Brandon K.

description: Solid sports bar with a medieval theme. Bartenders are nice here and there are quite a few TVs to catch the game on.
author: Sherry L.

description:
If you're looking for a great neighbourhood bar experience, this is it.  The staff are super friendly, the taps are reasonably varied, the atmosphere is awesome (nice and dark, even on a sunny day - just how a bar should be!) 

Pro tip: get the ham & brie on focaccia.  You're probably thinking: who willingly orders anything on focaccia? (I know, right?) WELL, you should here, because they make it in house and it's AWESOME.
author: Lol O.

description:
Service was fantastic, and the food / drinks were great. 
Got the steak tacos and they were delicious, along with the jalapeno coleslaw. 
Would definitely come back!
author: Missy K.

description: The service is very slow. Only one person working both the bar and restaurant. Not the nicest staff.
author: Teagan S.

description: Nice selection of beer on tap. The cheddar burger sliders and grilled cheese bites with tomato soup were awesome.
author: Tommy Y.

description: May is one of the best bartenders I've ever seen. She ran the bar and maintained excellent customer service. If she is not head bartender/manager soon, she should be. She made the experience for us. What a wonderful asset they have in her.
author: Kat S.

description:
Went on a Wednesday night. 
Great service by Shelby. 
Let's you try drinks and finds which ones are peculiar to your taste!
Will come again!
author: Noelle V.

description: Grilled cheese bites were the perfect combination of crunchy toast and gooey cheese. The veggie quesadillas  were packed with flavor and lots of veggies...and the house chardonnay was nice. We should have tried it earlier on our trip.
author: Lynette g.

description: Overall first impressions were great, 2 and time visitor to SF, better than average bar, better than average service, better than average food! Also very Quiet, so I can do a conference call while eating lunch!
author: David T.

description: This place is awesome. Great atmosphere and the food was amazing!! We had the calamari, crab cake sliders and sweet potato fries. The gold mojito sure hits the spot too!
author: Marissa G.

description: i got here at 6pm a couple weeks ago, as game 2 was starting and the manager made me move tables in the middle of a conversation because i was sitting by myself at a 4top table. i guess he thought they were going to be wildly busy. i was extremely irritated but i moved because ive worked in restaurants in the past and i get it. but you should have someone seating people in the first place if that's your thing. anyways. had a few beers, guac & chips, fish tacos. everything was pretty good. my server was super nice and attentive, but i forget her name. the manager ended up bringing me a shot over for free, i guess to make up for moving me and realizing that table never got sat lol. we are going back there tonight, so he redeemed himself I suppose. not many good spots to watch sports around union square but this place is chill
author: Taylor N.

description: Small little tavern off Powell st. with a very European older feel to it inside. Didn't get to make it in time for food but I did have a beer with my girlfriend and it was great. Cold beer is a necessity otherwise there is no point. Service was good as well. If your right there and you want a chill spot to just sip a brew than this place is nice. More laid back than a sports bar or a club
author: Robert G.

description: Good luck getting service, on a saturday only 2 people running the whole place. And the drink tasted horrible. We were with another party so we couldnt leave, but we would have if we could have.
author: Andy R.

description:
Their Speaks Prohibition Ale is very hood. It is so fresh and tastes great. 
I just finished eating their chicken Sandwich and it was good; it is not the bit very good. 
I like the server and he helps you a lot with choices. It is also open till 1 and their kitchen is open till 10:30 ish.
author: Iman B.

description: I will have to say, one of the better  meals we have had in SF. The service was impeccable, happy hour drinks were well thought out. We ordered the pub burger which came cooked to perfection on a nice bun. The only thing that would have made it  better would be to replace the Iceberg lettuce with a greener Romaine or Red.  If you are in the area, I highly recommend!
author: John E.

description:
Family and I visiting from Los Angeles,  dropped into the Last Drop Tavern for an afternoon snack. 
What a wonderful experience!
Grilled cheese bites with tomato soup,  buttermilk fried chicken sandwich,  small tacos--all delicious. 
But even more delightful was our host Shebli.  He graciously offered samples of beer for my wife's tasting and made us all feel welcome and right at home.  
A great spot for lunch or an afternoon pick me up. 
Thanks,  Shebli and your beautiful missus!
author: Robert L.

description:
5 of us went there at 10.30 p.m. on a wednesday night because the yelp details, menu, and reviews seemed great.
the only problem was they had no food available!!!!!!!!!
i think the yelp details should show that although they are open until 2 a.m. the food service stops at some undisclosed time!
author: John H.

description: Walked in on a Sunday around noon, completely empty.  The bartender was very nice.  Had some beers, mixed drinks, steak tacos, and beef sliders.  All were very good.  Not a sports bar by any means, but the don't claim to be.
author: Justin T.

description: Nice atmosphere with friendly service. They have a fun drink menu with an array of specialty cocktails and an eclectic selection of beers. We had the pulled pork sliders and bacon deviled eggs and they were both great. I would definitely come back here for a happy hour drink or two!
author: Megan M.

description:
The service here was awesome!!!! I will start with that. The manager helped us and gave us little samplers of the beers we wanted to try. 

The wings were good. Spicy and juicy. 

The selection is of beer was awesome and they have house made beer blends which was different. A must try if you're in the area.
author: Hortencia P.

description:
I went here with one other person and this was our experience:
1. I ordered the burger with a fried egg, avocado, and sweet potato fries. The burger was overcooked, along with the fried egg, and the fries were undercooked. 
2. They brought out the tiniest ketchup saucer expecting people to use that for both your fries and burgers.....and then it was difficult to get the waitress, who clearly had an attitude, to bring more 
3. The person I was with had the pork sliders, which said they were pretty good. 
4. Beer and mixed drinks were good and a good selection
5. The decor was odd. I think I felt it was so odd because it was partly medieval, but there were so many antlers hung around (they were the tiny antlers too) 
6. Plenty of TV's to watch whatever game is going on at the time
author: Jack R.

description: Food was bland. They lacked seasoning and I grabbed the salt/pepper shakers one too many times. The service was also pretty bad. The women were really snobby and when we asked for something, we wouldn't get much of a response. I was also blamed for a mistake in communication, but the server came off really rude instead of just taking care of it as it was a simple mistake.
author: Kristine B.

description: I came here due to the good reviews but was very disappointed by the quality of the food. I had the burger and sweet potato fries and my partner had the pork sliders, both meals were mediocre and the fries were tasteless, it was a real shame. It seemed like a good place to drink but not to eat, maybe i was unlucky. We were in the  US for 2 weeks and this was probably our worse meal.
author: Jo C.

description: Drinks are worth the $9-12 each... The blood orange margarita and Oaxacan are pretty good. That being said, our mussels were fine but sort of smelled like port-o-potty, the wings were undercooked and had forgettable sauce (6 to an order ), and the crab cake sliders tasted more like fried bread patties- no crab to be found. All these items were marked up HH items that are not worth purchasing at prime time. The service was adequate. Do yourself a favor and eat elsewhere.
author: Matt F.

description:
I've come here several times over the last few years when I'm in town and go to a local theater. After today I'll not try another spot. 
Happy Hour DAILY (!) 4-7. I love the Baja Fish Tacos (3 for $9). Moist, perfectly seasoned. Draft beer (I always get a local) $5. I deviated once to the Calamari but it doesn't hold a candle. 
Service courteous and professional. 
I'll eat here even if it's not happy hour!
PS-if you find a civilized way to eat these, please let me know. I hope no one watches me when I eat them. BUT I DON'T CARE IF THEY DO!  They're THAT good.
author: A. J.

description: Excellent food. Great drinks and awesome service. And we got to hang out with this guy.
author: Melissa N.

description:
Just as advertised. Great good, great drinks all reasonably priced.   Service was better than at restaurants that are multiple the price. 

European feel, small energetic space. 
Take the less traveled path and give it a try.
author: Jack G.

description: This was a little gem we ran into on accident but we were pleasantly surprised. Service was fast, attentive and friendly. The beers were priced well, and happy hour food was good sized portion and yummy. We got the fries and they had a good flavor especially with the spicy aioli!
author: Christy B.

description:
I wanted  to give this five stars to balance out those negative reviews. But then again, I have nothing bad to say about it. Our dinner here was spectacular!  Came here because it was right next door to the Marriott where we were staying. I was slightly apprehensive because of those negative reviews. Glad we opted to go. I had the Spinach & Kale salad with chicken. It was dressed perfectly and delicious. I ate every last little leaf of greens! My husband had the dinner special which was grilled pork cops. It looked amazing and he said it was. He too cleaned his plate. 

The calamari appetizer was good. Very tasty and tender.  

The Basil Lime Gimlet I had to drink was so good. Honestly I could get in trouble with those because they went don soooo easy!  Both tart and sweet. A little buzzed after two of them. 

Another plus is that it's a few blocks up from Union Square and while people down there were waiting for a table we walked right in and sat down! Do yourself a favor and GO! 

Really cute tavern atmosphere.
author: Teri F.

description: This was close to our hotel so we thought we'd give it a try.  Great food and service.  After striking out with other "tourist's spots", we were so excited to find this place!
author: Bettye D.

description: Great late night spot, good drink prices, great service... and wonderful crab cake sliders and sweet potato fries!!  Recently in town and stayed just down the way at the Westin, and this was our getaway bar on several nights.  Very down to earth bar /tavern ambience.
author: julie e.

description: Amazingly prompt service, good food, and a nice ambience for being in the middle of San Francisco.  Great Leffe beer on tap and they have Hendricks gin!
author: Scott O.

description:
This place from the outside like a dive type bar but when you walk it, its quite a surprise!! The decor looks fresh and updated and everything is sparkling clean.

We sat at the bar and before we could even get out coats of, the bartender was asking if she could get us a drink. Talk about great service! She check on us just the right amount and never let our glasses get empty until we were finished. 

We order an appetizer, spinach artichoke dip (fantastic) and she even noticed that the ratio of bread to dip was off and brought us more bread WITHOUT us having to ask!

I will definitely stop in here again, maybe next time for a full dinner.
author: Kayla R.

description: Ok, so this place is not for all. It's a small, dark bar. Its popular. So if you don't get known when you come in, you might get ignored (there is no front of house). But sat at the bar, the staff were friendly (even though it was busy), the beer selection good, and the food very nice. Certainly worth the slight walk up the hill and away from the tourists.
author: Patrick T.

description:
I was very excited about the food options here. Unfortunately, my experience with their delivery service has turned me off from ever ordering from here again. 

After forgetting our grilled cheese with tomato soup, we called to inform them of the mix up. They were unwilling to expedite the delivery after their mistake, so we waited another hour. Even worse, not only were the sandwiches cold, it was very clear that they had left the top off the soup container (which was inside the container with the sandwiches). As anyone could guess, the sandwiches were a cold, soggy mess. 

The food may be good (if it weren't all cold upon arrival), so I will just say, don't order delivery.
author: Genevieve L.

description: Cozy off the beaten path bar of SF. Old man bartender playing all the hits: beer, Jameson, gruff demeanor. It's got a good ambiance. Old style pub tables good for middle sized groups. Beer is cold and clean out for the tap. Bathrooms are clean. Take your friends here and have a couple.
author: Michael O.

description: Small, quaint, filthy bathroom, great place to stop during bar crawl for 1 drink. May return of passing by for a beer.
author: Daniel D.

description: We ordered delivery to our hotel room. They got the order partially wrong, sent another, also partially wrong... the food itself was fine, ai think if we ate it in the restaurant it would have been better. Not worth the $$ we paid for it.
author: Cristina C.

description: Great little bar with some decent food. Worth getting away from throngs in Union Square. Happy hour on weekends too!
author: Cindy D.

description: Walked by yesterday & said "Hey!  That crappy Mexican restaurant has changed!"  How lucky!  We dropped in & had a really nice lunch.  The burgers were top notch with super fresh tomatoes & lettuce.  The sweet potato fries perfect.  The best part was the atmosphere.  It's like eating in an English cellar.  Very cool.  I'm going to make it a regular!
author: Lovey B.

description:
Horrible cocktails. Tried 4 different drinks and the alcohol was cheap, the juice even cheaper. Definitely the worst $11 cocktail in the city.

This place probably only has 4 stars cause of all the tourists in the area.
author: Kelli W.

description: Not a dive and not just a bar. In a town with very expensive menus, this is a great find for a decent burger, salad, or both. Happy hour is until 7 on - a plus. Service is good. TV in sports if you like and nice tunes from the 70s in up on deck.
author: Linda G.

description: It was hot in the sun, but cold in the shade. What to do? Lets have a drink. Service was Johnny on the spot and the libations were more than I expected from the look of this place. Bar tender wasn't in the mood for small talk, so we moved on.
author: Steven M.

description: In two words, "not good".  This restaurant is all over the place, the chaotic theme of trying to please everyone made me regret walking in the door and proceed to regret the next 45 minutes of my life.  Effective feedback is a gift, so let me give you a strategy for creating a winning streak: focus on a single theme - something which supports a lovely place to socialize.  Marry food, decor and music to your theme to create "ambience" which enhances socializing.  Also,  remove the pre-packaged tortilla chips from your menu=Awful.  Don't order the Portabello sandwich or garlic fries=BAD.  Couldn't wait to run out the door. Re-living this experience is really bothering me.  I've got to remove it from my memory, please Baby Jesus help me.
author: Sophia M.

description: The bar food is slightly above average. We got the penne and carnitas street tacos. The beer selection was a little lacking in good options.
author: Ryan C.

description: Glad we found this one on Yelp & it lives up to the reviews. Helpful & friendly staff, fresh & tasty food. Perfect for the quieter night that we wanted. The kale & spinach salad was lovely & I'm not usually a fan of kale.
author: Heidi F.

description: Fantastic service on a cold Christmas night. Cheeseburger really hit the spot, worth every penny.
author: Jacob W.

description: A semi-hidden gem. Excellent service, Delicious menu options (honestly, I can't pick a favorite at this point - I don't think that you can go wrong with any selection). Just go there, relax, and enjoy!
author: Eric D.

description:
Very good food... Waitress was very nice.   It was a fun little walk up to the hill and the draft beer was like a dream come true.. Anchor Steam!

Fish and chips were very good and the fries were home made and tasty... Everyone at the table was happy..........until......

 the 5 inch cockroach joined us for dinner... It was the size of a chiwawa I $hit you not.  This Huge  day-time cockroach crawled all over the place... We named him Herman and got the F outta there.
author: Sam T.

description: Great atmosphere, attentive staff, very personable, great personalities! Me and my girlfriend had so much fun here! Rammy and aya were amazing and so attentive ! Will return
author: Andrea B.

description: Started with the Gorgonzola pear salad. It was marginal and a bit overpriced. Then added the beef sliders. They were okay but a side of something would have finished the plate. Now the good stuff; the mac and cheese with Black Forest ham was crazy good and creamy comfort food. Finishing it with bread pudding made a delicious end. Our waitress did a fine job with suggestions and a soft sell. She was nonintrusive and made us feel comfortable.
author: Melody P.

description: Garlic fries - yes! Grilled cheese app - yes!!! Buttermilk chicken sandwich - oh my YES YES YES!!!! Just come here, grab a beer or wine, watch the game and eat. Sorry no pics of food but it was too amazing, oh, and they helped charge my phone so wasn't here when food arrived. Great service, great food and great drinks. What more could you want?!?!?!?  Awesome find!!!!
author: Alys R.

description: Great staff. Very professional. Decent selection of beer. Wide variety of other spirits. Very professional bar tenders. Mature young crowd. Can have a conversation without screaming. Will return. Plenty of tvs if you want to watch the game.
author: Owen O.

description: Great service. Yummy food for bar food. Little grilled cheese bites were great. Fun cocktail list. We brought our three kids and strangely (unlike many other places in SF ) no one rolled their eyes. We went twice for drinks and apps during our week.
author: Liz W.

description: Great food, great happy hour, great staff.  Here for work for a week and came every night.  Would highly recommend! Ribs are bomb so is the calamari and the burger.
author: Richard R.

description: This place has consistently great food, great service, and great quality drinks. I love stopping by to grab the beef sliders and a honey-basil gimlet, I haven't tasted better of either. They also have really great happy hour specials for after work! The staff is always friendly and quick, and the atmosphere makes you feel a bit like you're in an english pub. I highly recommend it.
author: Jamie L.

description: Pretty good bar and restaurant! Excellent happy hour with 5 dollar drinks and cheap appetizers! Their calamari is super good and the burger was way better than burger bar. Ditch the touristy places in Union Square and come here!
author: Michael V.

description:
Stopped in for a cold beer and afternoon snacks.  The staff were friendly, service was great, and the food really good.  A nice place to drop by.

Many thanks.
author: Shan H.

description: Love this place. Stiff drinks, great food. Bartender will always know your name. Get the Smokey Donkey.
author: Adam P.

description: Stopped in here for a drink and a bite while checking out Christmas displays at Union Square and in the area. I was very glad we were there for happy hour. It was precisely the low-key atmosphere I was looking for after walking around the mall and Union Square and was ready to find a dark corner to just have a drink, some fries, and chat with friends. I only had the fries off of the happy hour menu and they were fresh, but I can't speak to anything else on the menu. Also, $5 well drinks and draft beers during happy hour are exactly how much I want to pay.
author: Phil L.

description: What a pleasant surprise.  Only a couple of blocks off Union Square.  Great bar food with a great juke box playing.
author: Steven B.

description: Came in here with my wife while visiting from out of town. This is a great place. The bartender was super nice and made some amazing drinks. The atmosphere is cool, and definitely fun. I'll be back here next time I come back into town.
author: Garrett S.

description: We came in during GDC, the staff was super friendly and personable, and the food was great. It was a perfect introduction to the San Francisco bar scene. Our bar tender was Mae with Ramey managing. Had blast!
author: Joseph B.

description: They have a buttermilk chicken sandwich with coleslaw on top that is pure beauty and delicious!  Cute bar like tavern.  Good for sports fans.  Lots of tvs in the small space.  Liked the castle like candles on the walls.
author: Jeanette W.

description: Bartender was great! Inside was like a slightly modernized castle. Fun. Decent bar food - good prices for the location so close to union square.
author: Breanna K.

description: First time to San Francisco and it rained the entire day. I was looking for a warm cozy pub with hearty food. I found exactly what I was looking for. Friendly staff, cozy atmosphere, and the best grilled cheese bites with tomato soup I have ever had in my life.
author: Felicia M.

description: Nice little place. Nice service. Food ok. Garlic fries smelled wonderful but tastes like fish.
author: Cherie S.

description: This place was like an episode of kitchen nightmares. Service was terrible and slow even though most tables were empty. One of my friends was served rotten sea food. When we told the waitress she said "are you sure? I eat them all the time?" The manager later asked "did you try them?" They smelled putrid that definitely would have given her food poising. They gave me a beer when i ordered wine and forgot to bring the dipping sauces and sides until after we'd finished everything. Other than that the rest of the food was average. They had the nerve to try and charge a 20% tip....yeah right.
author: Allison G.

description: Ok food, but forgot part of my order and weren't very accommodating in trying to fix it.
author: Kimberly R.

description: Went to this place tonight after a very long day,  going for some good food and drinks. We chose it based on its rating and its proximity to our hotel. We sat at a very dark table and when the server approached the table we asked what was on draft. She practically threw the menu at us and walked away. After waiting for almost 10 minutes for her to return, we noticed a better table and decided to move. When we passed the server to tell her,  she seemed annoyed with us,  but another server helped clear the table and even offered to turn the music down if it was too loud. After waiting another 10 minutes without even a drink order, we decided to leave.
author: Lisa W.

description: Good,  heavy,  drinks.  Nice pub food.  Not too pricey. Stumbling distance to the Orchard Hotel.
author: Nicole S.

description: $8.00 for a basket of 20 tortilla chips with a side of guacamole, $7 for a draft beer and $12 for the world's smallest Martini. This place is a rip off. If you wouldn't have raped me on the tortilla chips, I may have bought a couple of bottled beers on the next round, tipped you and retuned. Instead, you got your undeserving $29.36 without a tip, a negative YELP review (for all that's worth) and a couple of chapped customers that will avoid this over-priced, sterile establishment at all costs. Do yourselves some  favors and avoid this place and go up the street to Tunnel Top.
author: Adam H.

description: Wow, the smokey donkey sounds like a little bit of a goofy name but it was fantastic! I never knew I liked mezcal but I do now. The decor is kinda "world of warcraft" which I'm kinda not in love with, but it's still a cool bar with good drinks. More mezcal to come.
author: Kevin D.

description: I've been a couple times to the Last Drop and had a great experience both times. The staff was great, especially Tara who was very attentive and always made sure we were satisfied with our meals and our glasses were full. There is a decent beer selection and I enjoyed the fried chicken sandwich the first time, so I ordered it on my return visit. I'll have to try something different next time. Check it out, have a beer and say hi to Tara for me!
author: Stephen C.

description: I ordered my food online and it took way too long about 3 hours to get it delivered.  I called 1st time they said it was on its way then I called again they said they had issues with their computers and half the orders were missing yet when I called they had my order.  On top of that it was over priced and luke warm.  The only positive thing was the order was right.
author: Jose B.

description: An okay place. Pretty empty on a Sunday. Not the worst place to go. Cocktails around $9 to $10 starting. Didn't try the food. Nice bartenders. Obviously tourist central.
author: Cara F.

description: Awesome quiet bar near union square.  Lots of TVs, good decor, great chicken wings.  Good drink selection as well.
author: James M.

description: Wow...I don't know why I'm surprised but this place is great! Right around the corner from my hotel and I walked past it a few times before deciding to go in. Great drinks! Good food and just a cool atmosphere.
author: Molly S.

description: Good chicken sandwich tonight. Side salad. Service was slow at the bar, surprising on a slow Tuesday night. Decent beer selection but not great. Overall a nice place to chill for a bit.
author: David C.

description: Excellent cocktails, bartender was a seasoned veteran, no flash just finely made drinks and pints. Food was upscale bar fare, homemade rolls
author: Mike H.

description: I don't even know where to begin. The first impression was good, we got seated right away but then it began. Our waitress took forever then couldn't get our drink orders right. I ordered Mussels and as soon as she put the dish down, I knew something was off. It smelled terrible like rotten eggs. So I'm sitting there toying with my food wondering if my sense of smell is off. But my friends smell it and they said yeah it smells horrible. I tell our server, she replies well I eat this every week and it is always fine. Then she smells it and asks me if I had tried it. Why so i could get food poisoning, no thanks. I asked her if she could just get me a salad instead and she replies, sorry the kitchen is backed up. Then we ask for the manager and the manager was also very defensive and rude. I ended up eating fries off my friends plate. When it came time to pay the check it took her several attempts to get it right. Never going there again.
author: Anisha N.

description: Great menu, awesome service, very good looking menu. Didnt try any food but had a good assortment of beer on tap. Highly recommend!
author: Markus H.

description: Great food, good service, nice cold drinks. Last Drop is a perfect place to duck into with friends or solo.  The mid-evil touches made the bar feel extra cozy and comfortable.   I will probably stop here next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Samantha B.

description: Wonderful little place with great food and drinks, and not frightening prices. Stopped after arriving from Miami, and I so wish we had more places like this in south Florida. Good, comfortable, no pretensions, and quite friendly thanks to bartender/server Mae.  Great informal place very close to union square.
author: Dan C.

description: Came to SF for a week for my birthday and happened to stumble upon this gem. Only place I've ever been able to actually get a med rare slider. The bar tender who also was my server (Milton) was fantastic. Very cool place, better looking on the inside than the out.
author: Christy S.

description: Service was great. Prices were reasonable. Clientele was fun. Went in alone for a quick drink - met fun people.  I would highly recommend.
author: Ang S.

description: We just kind of stumbled upon this place, but glad we did. The bar tender was a class act and the food was delicious!
author: Linda C.

description: Visited last weekend. After looking at reviews I know I would never go back or recommend this place to anyone unless they change managers. The manager we interacted with had a huge chip on his shoulder and was very offensive to me and my friends. Our waitress was great but I felt she was trying to make up for his rude behavior.  Drinks were good, but our food never arrived ...
author: Luna M.

description: Really glad I found this little tavern. It's not been too crowded the few times I have been here, usually Sunday as it's opening. Great drinks, fast service. GREAT feel.
author: Chris M.

description: Stopped in for lunch without reading any reviews.  Pleasantly surprised with the great service and good food. Sat at the bar. Started with the grilled cheese bites, very tasty. For mains we had the ham and Brie sandwich and portobello mushroom sandwich.  Both excellent.  Great selection of tap and bottle beer also. I didn't partake, but the scotch selection looked great also. Highly recommend this place if you are in the area.
author: R T.

description: The bar was good and appetizer was just right. I felt really bad for the bartender who was desperately trying to serve the whole place for about an hour before someone appeared to help her. They had many interesting sounding drinks on the menu, tried the mojito, pretty tasty.
author: Amanda W.

description: Great little bar with an amazing kitchen. Definitely not your typical bar food. Good specials. Would definitely go back.
author: Mick F.

description: I love this bar! Perfect location - on the hill with cable cars going back ant forth. Best bar to bring you visiting friends or family! Food is great, drinks are made right, personnel is very positive and friendly!
author: Mariya Delilah D.

description: Great atmosphere. Very good drinks and food was top shelf bar fare. If you sit at the bar you will be lucky to have Tara as your awesome mixologist. She's a ray of sunshine.
author: Todd B.

description: Really quaint place.  Good appetizer menu.  Got a vodka basil gimlet.  Was fantastic.  Great staff.  Would visit again.
author: Jo M.

description:
In SFO on business and this joint is right behind the Marriott Union. Awesome fish tacos, great guac, cold beer!
Definitely recommend!
author: David D.

description: Don't let the name fool you.... Great hidden gem with food to die for. The deviled eggs were sinfully good. Staff were amazingly friendly. Wish this was my neighborhood bar.
author: Henry S.

description: In San Francisco on business and happened on this place. Great service and great beer.  The grilled cheese bites are awesome as well as the beef sliders.  Great place to stop in and get good beer and good food.
author: Imran K.

description:
If you want awesome food, good beer, and great service, this is the place to go! 
Our bartender (the manager) was Amazing! 
This is my new favorite place!
author: Leyany F.

description: I ordered the Protobella Mushroom Sandwich and a Blueberry Lemon Drop to drink and I was so happy with both. This is the best mushroom sandwich I've ever had. The ambiance is very chill and the wait staff is friendly.
author: Frankie L.

description: Perfect afternoon lunch.  Shared the fish and chips which were huge and plenty big for 2 people. Also had a delish margarita. The bartender/waiter/host was helpful and charming. In a sea of touristy rip-off restaurants in the area, this place was surprisingly good.
author: Ryan G.

description: We come to San Francisco every year for vacation and are always looking for new bars to go to. After reading the previous reviews we almost decided not to try this place out. I have to say I AM GLAD we did end up trying it. They must have a newer manager than the guy from the previous posts. We have an outstanding time the first night with Fernie as our server. Going in for a second time we hung out at the bar with Milton and had a good time as well. this will definitely be a nightly destination for us in our future vacations!
author: Chris C.

description: This place is great. Came across this place the first night in town and made it back for the last night. Great food, service and vibe. Super relaxed, not stuffy and reasonably priced food.
author: Darci M.

description: I stopped in here for a bite and a beer before a performance at a theater on Sutter St. The California (chicken) sliders were great. The two young women behind the bar were attentive. The place kind of looks like a dive bar, a little dark, but it was very clean and the crowd was mostly in their 30s. Some were clearly local, maybe getting off work, and others were probably like me, looking for something simple in a relaxed environment. It was busy but not noisy, mainly because the music wasn't too loud. The beer list is short but fine. The spirit selection is large. The Giants were on TV, what more could you want. O, and the prices were very reasonable. If I'm in that area again I would definitely return.
author: KARL C.

description: Was searching the area for good steak dinner and thought would give it a shot since was late and options were few.  We made a great choice... Food, service, and quaint bar atmosphere fit the bill.
author: Vicky S.

description: Had the grilled cheese bites with tomato soup. It was delish. The white sangria was perfectly done. Great service and music too.
author: Mercedes G.

description:
Came here for an appetizer and beers with my parents. The place is great - dark and pub-like with cool decor. 

I am only giving 3 stars as the service was not up to par. It must have been the waitresses first night because she had to ask us 3 times for our drink order (we ordered beers, nothing crazy!). We also ordered chips and guac. For the first time in my life, there was more guacamole than there were chips (yay). We asked for more chips to finish up the guac and the waitresses wouldn't bring us any. Chips are the cheapest thing, we weren't asking for huge favors!

Anyways, I'd probably give it another chance, but wish the service was better.
author: KC W.

description: First, a disclaimer: we got delivery, so it's possible that the dine-in experience is totally different. The food quality was just totally disappointing for the price. My mom got a burger, which was fine and cooked to order, but the fries seemed to be made from some kind of cardboard-potato-styrofoam hybrid. Not a fan. I ordered salmon and vegetables. Pros: it was indeed salmon, and it seemed to have been cooked to safe internal temperature. Cons: it was a hunk of bland fish with zero seasoning, and the vegetables were of the squishy, wet, you-definitely-just-microwaved-a-bag-of-Green-Giant variety. Would not order from this place again.
author: Allison P.

description: The food was missing some spices, even basic like pepper and salt. The fajitas was served in a Warm pan resulting them to be dry after a while. The burger needed some sauce because it was dry. The waitress missed things in the order.
author: Aruiner D.

description: Very clean, great food, and beverages. Wife and I enjoyed it very much . They have bread pudding too!
author: Tyler C.

description: I'll give this place 2 stars because the food was good but the service was terrible. I have never had a waitress get so blatantly pissed because we asked for separate bills. Even the manager was rude when we went through this: apparently it is our fault:
author: Erika C.

description: Stopped for a drink at happy hour. Fantastic bartender who really knows what he is doing. Didn't order food so can't comment
author: Steve M.

description: Shebli was AMAZING! He provided fantastic service, great conversation and an absolutely delicious old fashioned. This place is a perfect place to stop any time of day for good food and even better drinks.
author: Breanne L.

description: Nice place to stop at for late night bites. It looks like a dive from outside but is actually really nice inside. Good spot to sit down. Drink menu has lots of specialty cocktails to choose from. Prices were good for drinks and bites considering its downtown. $50 bill for 3 apps and 4 drinks for the table. It's not crowded or too loud at night so you can actually talk to your friends.
author: Brad G.

description: Great place, very friendly.  The bartender gave us tour advice.  The chicken tortilla soup is delicious.
author: Bill L.

description: Did an online order. Called a few times and order not received. Asked to speak to the manager and whoever answered hung up on me. I finally got my order after 1 hour 20 min and food was cold so I threw it away
author: Kristi G.

description: came across this place while walking around, hidden gem loved the place, food and service
author: Dale K.

description: This is an awesome place that ordinarily I wouldn't have given a second glance. However, I was in Union Square looking for someplace to eat and Yelp recommended this place. It was about 1:30 on a Friday afternoon, but the place was quiet except for 3 or 4 other people. I got the sense this is the kind of place that could fill up around dinner time or during special events, though. There were a couple of tvs on the walls but they didn't detract from the atmosphere. I sat at the bar. The bartender, Shibli, was easygoing, soft-spoken and friendly. I ordered the fish and chips with a lagunitas IPA - absolutely fabulous, not too greasy, good tartar sauce, and I thought the little corked glass pitcher of vinegar Shibli pulled from behind the bar was a nice touch, rather than just a "help yourself" bottle already on the counter. Very good beer selection, and even a nice range of cocktails. While this place looks like a dive bar on the outside it's actually somewhat upscale inside, but the prices are very reasonable, considering. I would definitely go back, and I recommend it to anyone passing through Union Square.
author: John M.

description: Great food and even better atmosphere! Immaculately clean and Shibley, the manager, went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of! We were in from out of town for the weekend and came here twice! Tavern salad, burger and chicken sandwich did not disappoint. We will be back!
author: Sara P.

description: Great bar and restaurant!  We ordered the mac and cheese with bacon and the caesar salad with chicken.  Both were great!  The chicken is definitely worth the additional charge and the mac and cheese was super creamy and didn't taste like it had been sitting around all day.  The seating options allow for some privacy with your group and we just had a very nice and relaxed time at this bar.  Highly recommend!
author: K N J.

description:
I urge you to NOT go to The Last Drop Tavern!! 
I am the owner of a very established and well known Italian restaurant in Downtown Seattle. I grew up working in restaurants and eat out quite often. I appreciate good service and have never been treated so rudely as we were treated when we went to The Last Drop Tavern. My wife and I spent the weekend in San Francisco with 2 other couples a few days ago. When the 6 of us entered the bar, we were the only ones in there. I thought it was odd that the place was empty and we soon learned why... 
We ordered appetizers and a drink and proceeded to chat amongst ourselves in a reasonable and normal tone. We ordered another round and then ordered entrees. The appetizers were humorously small and lacked flavor.
There was a very serious looking gentleman watching our table like a hawk. We asked the waitress (who was very nice) if the gentleman was the owner. She shook her head and sort of chuckled. No, he is the Manager, she said.
He continued to watch our table with a menacing look.
The Manager soon approached our table and, to our disbelief, asked us to quiet down or he was going to kick us out. We are all approaching 50 years old and are business owners/executives. We thought that he was kidding at first but he told us that he was definitely not kidding. 
We were astonished and genuinely bewildered. He then asked us to leave so we did.    
I never go to social media to vent because it can be so damaging to a business but felt strongly that I needed to let others know how rude and unprofessional that the Manager is. Please do not go to The Last Drop Tavern!
author: David E.

description: Incompetent service, mediocre food, TVs blasting that you cannot hear yourself... Don't go there for food.
author: Timur M.

description: New ownership !!! Great Place, we stopped by accidentally and was impressed . Great beers all Around, bartender and manager were very helpful. True the grilled cheese and soup, very good. Soup was flavored well and grilled cheese was very cheesy, excellent choice. Give this place a try. We happens to stumble on a soccer game and they were more then willing to put it on !!!
author: Kopi O.

description: This is place is awesome!! I really wish this was my neighborhood bar. The service is great and you don't feel overwhelmed by large crowds or feel out of place if you're 30 and under in comparison to other bars.
author: Melisa R.

description: This restaurant is close to our hotel and it didn't disappoint. We were seated quickly and waited on as soon as we sat down. My husband had the wings and I had the salmon, both were very good.  The atmosphere was fun and lively.  I would definitely go back.
author: Janel D.

description: This place was great other than the manager looking guy. My friend and I came in for a few drinks and food, drinks were good price and food was great but this guy just wouldn't leave us alone. I would assume he is the manager by the way he was dressed. He kept taking away from the bartender (who was very nice by the way I think her name is Fernnie?). Just like the other reviews he had a huge chip on his shoulder and just kept bothering us. Gave an extra star for bartenders service
author: Mario L.

description: Great location, fantastic vibe, bartender/manager made us special drinks. Food was very good. Loved the atmosphere! Come check it out.
author: Mustang S.

description: Stopped by with friends for a drink and ordered the calamari.  We had been in Monterey a day earlier and the Last Drop won hands down.  Sweet, tender calamari that was breaded just right and served piping hot.  Chef Heather came to our table after we conveyed our compliments through the bartender.  Stop by if you're in the area!  We also noted the cleanliness of the establishment.  Worth a visit!
author: Kevin F.

description: The staff was very accommodating. Great drinks and great food. The calamari was award winning
author: Sheena C.

description: Excellent food. Best bar food we had in four days in SF. Good beer selection and attentive service. HH prices very reasonable. Sliders are amazing and the bacon deviled eggs absolutely delish!
author: Jodie M.

description: what a wonderful place. the environment is really very good and the services are quick. staff is very helping. i am impressed by the overall architecture of the place
author: Aleena N.

description: We came here just wanting a hamburger and drinks, was very pleasantly surprised. The burgers were some of the best we ever had, and the drink selection was great. Would absolutely come again.
author: Kelly G.

description: Everything was fantastic, including the grilled cheese bites and bbq ribs. Happy hour was a special bonus, as draft beers were only $5. However, we should have went with the $5 well whiskey. As it was my birthday, I decided to allow my girlfriends grandmother to treat me to a shot of Jameson Black. While delicious, at $15, it was between $5-$7 more than any other place I'd had it in a number of different states. That was the least of our worries. When it came time to check out, 5 minutes after giving her our card, she alerted us to the fact that the credit card machine was down and we could pay cash or wait 5-10 minutes. After 15 minutes, she informed us that there was an ATM outside if we didn't want to wait any longer. Of course, we weren't interested in paying an ATM fee on top of our already inflated bill. 20 minutes later, after running the card several times, they insisted that we did not have enough money in our account. Turns out, we did, and our card was charged twice for a grand total of $114.26. They then informed us that our account would not be credited the overcharged amount until the next day. Then they made us sign a permission slip giving them authority to recharge the card for the original amount. As a final gesture of good will, they said they were sorry and wished they could comp it. Don't let the lure of happy hour fool you, take your money and your debit card somewhere else. In closing, I will say they lived up to their name, as I left the "last drop" of my patience on the bar.
author: Pac N.
